original: dge slong dag 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang 'jig rten 'gog pa dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyis rab tu mthong ba dang / rab tu rig pa dang ;
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang 'jig rten 'gog pa dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyis rab tu mthong ba dang / rab tu rig pa dang ;
translated: Monks, it is thus: the noble disciple who is learned, who sees the arising and passing away of the world together with its causes, who sees it as it really is with wisdom,🔽who fully understands it,🔽who fully comprehends it,

original: rab tu yid la byed pa dang / rab tu bsten pa dang / yang dag par rab tu rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rab tu yid la byed pa dang / rab tu bsten pa dang / yang dag par rab tu rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: who fully relies on it, and who fully knows it,

original: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pas /
analyzed: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pas /
translated: The mind is the basis of the conception of “I,”

original: bdag ces nye bar 'dogs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag ces nye bar 'dogs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: therefore it is designated as “self.”

original: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid bdag gi mgon yin te //
translated: The self is the protector of the self;

original: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni su zhig mgon du gyur //
translated: who else could be the protector?

original: bdag nyid legs par dul na ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par dul na ni //
translated: When the self is well-tamed,

original: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas mtho ris thob par 'gyur //
translated: the wise one attains heaven.

original: gzung bar dka' zhing myur bar 'jug / gang du 'dod pa der 'jug byed //
analyzed: gzung bar dka' zhing myur bar 'jug / gang du 'dod pa der 'jug byed //
translated: Difficult to grasp, swift, going wherever it wishes,

original: sems dul ba ni legs pa ste //
analyzed: sems dul ba ni legs pa ste //
translated: the mind is well-tamed,

original: sems dul ba ni bde bar 'dren //
analyzed: sems dul ba ni bde bar 'dren //
translated: the mind well-tamed leads to happiness.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang po las 'don te /🔽ji ltar re zhig glang gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong zhes bya ba ni mdo sde mang po las 'don te / ji ltar re zhig glang gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: For example, the sutras state:

original: dge slong dag drug po 'di dag la rtag tu gnas par bya ste drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag drug po 'di dag la rtag tu gnas par bya ste drug gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, these six should always be practiced. What are the six?

original: dge slong dag 'di la dge slong mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di la dge slong mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Monks, in this regard, when a monk sees visible forms with the eye, he does not experience pleasure,

original: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: he does not experience displeasure,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas btang snyoms su gnas so //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas btang snyoms su gnas so //
translated: he remains equanimous, mindful, and clearly comprehending.

original: rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces dri dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces dri dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: When he hears sounds with the ear, smells odors with the nose, tastes tastes with the tongue, feels touchable objects with the body, or cognizes mental phenomena with the mind, he does not experience pleasure,

original: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid mi bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: he does not experience displeasure,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: he remains equanimous, mindful, and clearly comprehending.

original: drug po 'di dag gis rtag tu gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni rim gror bya ba /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag gis rtag tu gnas pa dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni rim gror bya ba /
translated: A monk who always practices these six is worthy of offerings,

original: bkur stir bya ba /
analyzed: bkur stir bya ba /
translated: worthy of hospitality,🔽worthy of reverential salutations,🔽and is the supreme field of merit.

original: thal mo sbyar bar bya ba /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar bya ba /
translated: One should join one’s palms in reverence.

original: rab tu rjed par bya ba bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi yon gnas zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rab tu rjed par bya ba bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi yon gnas zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: They are called “fields of merit” and “worthy of offerings of the world.”

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sūtra says, “The eye consciousness apprehends forms,” and so on.

original: 'dod pa rnams nyes dmigs mang por 'chad pa'i mdo las 'don pa dang / skye mched drug gi tshogs kyi mdo de dang de las @45a * //🔽gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams nyes dmigs mang por 'chad pa'i mdo las 'don pa dang / skye mched drug gi tshogs kyi mdo de dang de las @45a * // gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The sūtra on the many faults of desire and the sūtra on the collection of six bases say,

original: bcom ldan 'das ko ru pa na ko la ma shi'i grong khyer na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ko ru pa na ko la ma shi'i grong khyer na bzhugs te /
translated: “The Bhagavān was staying in the city of Kolita in the country of Kuru.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: dge slong dag thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: ‘Monks, this is the Dharma discourse that is good in the beginning,🔽good in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po /
translated: and good in the end.🔽It has good meaning,

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: good words,

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: is unadulterated,🔽complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: and purified.

original: tshangs par spyod pa /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa /
translated: It is the holy life.

original: yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i chos bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i chos bshad par bya ste /
translated: I will explain the Dharma that fully illuminates.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shing dang / bshad par bya'o//
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung shing dang / bshad par bya'o//
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, I will explain the Dharma discourse called The Four Chapters.

original: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na /🔽dge slong dag mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / rab tu dga' bar byed pa yod de /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs gang zhe na / dge slong dag mig gis shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / rab tu dga' bar byed pa yod de /
translated: What is the Dharma discourse called The Four Chapters?🔽Monks, there are forms cognizable by the eye that are desirable, lovely, pleasant, delightful, sensual, and tantalizing.

original: de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par dga' ba dang / brjod pa dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen cing gnas pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par dga' ba dang / brjod pa dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen cing gnas pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang /
translated: Seeing them, a monk may delight in them, take pleasure in them, and remain with attachment and longing. Forms cognizable by eye consciousness that are undesirable, unlovely, unpleasant, and unappealing,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa dang yid dang mi mthun pa yod de /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa dang yid dang mi mthun pa yod de /
translated: unpleasant, undesirable, unappealing, painful, and disagreeable.

original: de dag mthong na dge slong sdang ba dang / khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / mi mos pa dang / rab tu mi dga' zhing khro ba skyed pa 'di ni dge slong bdud sdig can gyi dbang du song zhing log par song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag mthong na dge slong sdang ba dang / khro ba dang / gnod sems dang / mi mos pa dang / rab tu mi dga' zhing khro ba skyed pa 'di ni dge slong bdud sdig can gyi dbang du song zhing log par song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When he sees them, the monk becomes angry, hostile, and malicious, and he feels aversion and distress. This is called a monk who has fallen under the power of the evil Mara and has been seduced by him.

original: bdud sdig can gyis ji ltar dga' mgur byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis ji ltar dga' mgur byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called one whom the evil Mara does as he wishes with.

original: bdud kyi 'ching ba las ma grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'ching ba las ma grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa zhes brjod do //
translated: He is called one who is not freed from Mara’s bonds and who is under Mara’s control.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de /🔽de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par dga' ba dang / brjod pa dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen cing gnas pa dang / yid kyi rnam @45b par shes par bya ba'i chos mi 'dod pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de / de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par dga' ba dang / brjod pa dang / zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen cing gnas pa dang / yid kyi rnam @45b par shes par bya ba'i chos mi 'dod pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang /
translated: There are objects that are to be cognized by the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, which are desirable, lovely, pleasant, delightful, attractive, enjoyable, and gratifying.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa yod de /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa yod de /
translated: Having seen them, the monk becomes delighted, excited, and attached, and he dwells with a mind that is excessively attached. There are objects that are to be cognized by the mind, which are undesirable, unlovely, unpleasant, not delightful, unattractive, not enjoyable, and not gratifying.

original: de dag mthong nas snga ma bzhin du khro ba nas bdud sdig can gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag mthong nas snga ma bzhin du khro ba nas bdud sdig can gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Having seen them, as before, he becomes angry, and Māra does with him as he wishes.

original: dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de /🔽de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mi brjod pa dang / ma zhen pa dang / lhag par ma zhen cing gnas pa dang / dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs mi 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de / de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mi brjod pa dang / ma zhen pa dang / lhag par ma zhen cing gnas pa dang / dge slong dag mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs mi 'dod pa dang /
translated: “Monks, there are forms that are objects of eye-consciousness that are desirable, lovely, attractive, pleasing, arousing, delightful,🔽and desirable.

original: mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa dag yod de /
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / nad dang / rjes su mi mthun pa dag yod de /
translated: Monks, there are forms that are objects of eye-consciousness that are undesirable, unlovely, unattractive, unpleasing, not arousing, not delightful,🔽and undesirable.

original: de dag mthong nas mi sdang ba dang / mi khro ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / mi mos pa dang / rab tu mngon par mi dga' ba ma yin pa dang / khong khro ba mi skyed pa 'di ni dge slong bdud sdig can gyi dbang du ma song zhing legs par ma song ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag mthong nas mi sdang ba dang / mi khro ba dang / gnod sems med pa dang / mi mos pa dang / rab tu mngon par mi dga' ba ma yin pa dang / khong khro ba mi skyed pa 'di ni dge slong bdud sdig can gyi dbang du ma song zhing legs par ma song ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seeing them, he is not angry, not irritated, not hostile, not contemptuous, not disdainful, and does not generate anger. This is called a monk who has not fallen under the power of the evil Māra and has not gone well.

original: bdud sdig to can gyi 'dod dgur byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can gyi 'dod dgur byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o /
translated: This is called not doing as the evil Māra wishes.

original: bdud kyi 'ching ba las grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'ching ba las grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called being free from the bonds of Māra and not coming under the power of Māra.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang ; yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / 'dod par bya ba dang / dga' bar bya ba yod de /
translated: There are phenomena that are to be cognized by the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, which are desirable, lovely, pleasant, delightful, desirable, and enjoyable.

original: de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mi brjod pa dang / ma zhen pa dang / lhag par ma zhen cing gnas pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i chos mi 'dod pa dang / mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de dag mthong nas dge slong mngon par mi dga' ba dang / mi brjod pa dang / ma zhen pa dang / lhag par ma zhen cing gnas pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'i chos mi 'dod pa dang / mi dga' ba dang /
translated: Having seen them, the monk is not delighted, does not speak, does not cling, does not cling excessively, and remains.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba nas snga ma bzhin du bdud kyi 'ching ba las grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba nas snga ma bzhin du bdud kyi 'ching ba las grol zhing bdud kyi dbang du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He does not desire, is not delighted, and does not find pleasant the phenomena to be known by mental consciousness, up to being liberated from the bonds of Māra and not coming under the power of Māra.

original: 'di ni le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs te /🔽dge @46a * //🔽slong dag thog mar dge ba /
analyzed: 'di ni le'u bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs te / dge @46a * // slong dag thog mar dge ba /
translated: This is the Dharma discourse called The Fourth Chapter.🔽Monks, I have taught that the Dharma should be explained as follows:🔽it is virtuous in the beginning,

original: bar du dge ba /
analyzed: bar du dge ba /
translated: virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po /
translated: and virtuous in the end.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: It has excellent meaning and excellent words.

original: zhes sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i chos bstan par bya ba'o zhes ngas bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i chos bstan par bya ba'o zhes ngas bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: I have taught that the Dharma should be explained in this way. I will now explain it in detail.

original: bram ze mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la /
analyzed: bram ze mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la /
translated: Brahmin, the eye is for seeing forms.

original: sgo yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgo yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eye is the door for the arising of visual consciousness.

original: skye mched drug gi tshogs las bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi tshogs las bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: The first line of the second verse of the summary of the six sense bases is:

original: brtson dang gzhan dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: brtson dang gzhan dang yang dag ldan //
translated: “Diligence and the others are endowed with the correct path.”🔽The summary of the first verse of the summary of the six sense bases is:🔽“The teeth of the nāga of ignorance,🔽the sūtra of Kātyāyana,

original: ma rig sprul gyi so dag dang // thos dang k'a ty'a ya na dang // sna tshogs dga' ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: ma rig sprul gyi so dag dang // thos dang k'a ty'a ya na dang // sna tshogs dga' ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: and the sense faculty that delights in variety.”

original: zhes bya ba las k'a ty'a ya na'i mdo 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las k'a ty'a ya na'i mdo 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: The Sūtra of Kātyāyana is recited as follows:

original: de nas bram ze dmar po yud tsam mi smra bar 'dug nas k'a ty'a ya na chen po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bram ze dmar po yud tsam mi smra bar 'dug nas k'a ty'a ya na chen po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the red-robed brahman remained silent for a moment and said to Mahākātyāyana,

original: k'a ty'a ya na sgo sgo zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na sgo sgo zhes brjod pa /
translated: “Kātyāyana, you say ‘door, door.’

original: ci ste sgo sgo zhes brjod /
analyzed: ci ste sgo sgo zhes brjod /
translated: Why do you say ‘door, door’?🔽”

original: smras pa / bram ze legs so legs so ;
analyzed: smras pa / bram ze legs so legs so ;
translated: Kātyāyana said, “Brahman, good, good.

original: sgo sgo zhes bya ba'i dri ba dri bar rigs so //
analyzed: sgo sgo zhes bya ba'i dri ba dri bar rigs so //
translated: It is appropriate to ask the question ‘door, door.’

original: ngas khyod sgo'i dri ba lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas khyod sgo'i dri ba lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the answer to your question ‘door.’

original: bram ze mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no //
analyzed: bram ze mig ni gzugs rnams mthong bar bya ba la sgo yin no //
translated: Brahman, the eye is the door for seeing forms.

original: rna ba ni sgra /🔽sna ni dri /
analyzed: rna ba ni sgra / sna ni dri /
translated: The ear is the door for the perception of sounds.

original: lce ni ro /
analyzed: lce ni ro /
translated: The nose is the door for the perception of smells.🔽The tongue is the door for the perception of tastes.

original: lus ni reg bya /
analyzed: lus ni reg bya /
translated: The body is the door for the perception of tactile objects.

original: yid ni chos rnams par shes par bya ba la sgo yin no //
analyzed: yid ni chos rnams par shes par bya ba la sgo yin no //
translated: The mind is the door for the perception of all dharmas.

original: smras pa / k'a ty'a ya na khyod kyis sgo sgo zhes dri ba dris pa la sgo sgo zhes lung bstan pa ni ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: smras pa / k'a ty'a ya na khyod kyis sgo sgo zhes dri ba dris pa la sgo sgo zhes lung bstan pa ni ngo mtshar ro //
translated: Kātyāyana replied, “It is amazing that you have answered the question ‘What is a door?’ with the answer ‘A door is a door!’”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha said, “I have said that you should not be attached to the words of the people of the world.

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad par khams drug dang / skye mched drug 'chi bar brjod pa la sogs pa'i mdo gsum las bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang po'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad par khams drug dang / skye mched drug 'chi bar brjod pa la sogs pa'i mdo gsum las bshad de /
translated: In the first chapter of the Prajñāpāramitā Sūtra, the Buddha said that the six elements and the six sense bases are impermanent, and so on.

original: ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not be attached to the words of the people of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la rgyug par mi bya'o zhes ngas bshad pa de rgyas par cung zad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la rgyug par mi bya'o zhes ngas bshad pa de rgyas par cung zad bshad par bya ste /
translated: I have said that you should not be attached to the names of the world. I will now explain this in more detail.

original: ji tsam gyis na ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par 'gyur zhing ji tsam gyis na 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na ljongs kyi mi'i tshig la mngon par zhen par 'gyur zhing ji tsam gyis na 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become attached to the words of the people of the country? How do they run after worldly names?

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Monks, it is like this:

original: dngos po gcig po 'di nyid la skye bo kha cig ka si zhes bya bar shes shing rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dngos po gcig po 'di nyid la skye bo kha cig ka si zhes bya bar shes shing rab tu shes so //
translated: Regarding this very single thing, some people know and understand it as a “bowl.”

original: lhung bzed ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: lhung bzed ces bya ba'am /
translated: Some know and understand it as a “begging bowl.”

original: shi shi la zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: shi shi la zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Some know and understand it as a “śīśa.”

original: rtsa ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽tsi ta zhes bya @46b ba'am /🔽snod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya ba'am / tsi ta zhes bya @46b ba'am / snod ces bya ba'am /
translated: Some know and understand it as a “root.”🔽Some know and understand it as a “cītra.”🔽Some know and understand it as a “vessel.”

original: kham phor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kham phor zhes bya bar rab tu shes so //
translated: Some know and understand it as a “bowl.”

original: ji lta ji ltar skye bos shes pa de lta de ltar bstan cing spyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang tha snyad du byed de 'di nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar skye bos shes pa de lta de ltar bstan cing spyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang tha snyad du byed de 'di nyid bden gyi /
translated: Just as people know it, they teach, practice, become attached, and use conventions, saying, “This alone is true.

original: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed de /
analyzed: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed de /
translated: The others are confused.”

original: ji ltar skye bo rnams kyi nges tshig gi don du byas pa yin no zhes tha snyad du mi byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar skye bo rnams kyi nges tshig gi don du byas pa yin no zhes tha snyad du mi byed de /
translated: They do not use conventions saying, “It is not made for the meaning of the etymology of people.”

original: de bzhin du kha cig gis bdag tu rab tu shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig gis bdag tu rab tu shes la /
translated: In the same way, some people understand the self to be

original: sems can zhes bya ba'am /🔽gso ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽skyes bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba'am / gso ba zhes bya ba'am / skyes bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: a sentient being,🔽a living being,🔽a person,🔽an individual,🔽a human,

original: gang zag ces bya ba'am /🔽shed las skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽shed bu zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba'am / shed las skyes pa zhes bya ba'am / shed bu zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: or a human being.🔽In this way, they understand it to be this or that.

original: de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi /
translated: They make statements such as, “This alone is the truth.

original: gzhan ni gti mug go zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gti mug go zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Everything else is delusion.”

original: ji ltar don brjod par bya ba'i phyir byas so zhes tha snyad du mi byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar don brjod par bya ba'i phyir byas so zhes tha snyad du mi byed de /
translated: They do not make statements such as, “It is a fabrication in order to express a meaning.”

original: de ltar na ljongs kyi mi nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen cing 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ljongs kyi mi nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen cing 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they become attached to the definitions of the people of the country and they run after worldly names.

original: ji ltar na ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par mi zhen cing 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par mi zhen cing 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they not become attached to the definitions of the people of the country and not run after worldly names?

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, it is like this:

original: dngos po gcig po de nyid la skye bo kha cig gis ka si zhes bya bar shes shing rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dngos po gcig po de nyid la skye bo kha cig gis ka si zhes bya bar shes shing rab tu shes so //
translated: In regard to that very same thing, some people know and understand it as a bowl.

original: lhung bzed ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: lhung bzed ces bya ba'am /
translated: Some understand it as a begging bowl.

original: she shi la zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: she shi la zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Some understand it as a śeṣila.

original: rtsa ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽tsi ta zhes bya ba'am /🔽snod ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba zhes bya ba'am / tsi ta zhes bya ba'am / snod ces bya ba'am /
translated: Some understand it as a root.🔽Some understand it as a cīna.🔽Some understand it as a vessel.

original: kham phor zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kham phor zhes bya bar rab tu shes te /
translated: Some understand it as a pot.🔽As people understand it, it is taught, analyzed, and conceptualized.

original: ji lta ji ltar skye bos rab tu shes pa de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed mod kyi /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar skye bos rab tu shes pa de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed mod kyi /
translated: Through attachment, it is said, “This alone is true, the others are ignorant.”

original: skye bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don du tha snyad du byed do //🔽de bzhin du kha cig bdag ces rab tu shes shing sems can zhes bya ba'am /🔽gso ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: skye bo rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig gi don du tha snyad du byed do // de bzhin du kha cig bdag ces rab tu shes shing sems can zhes bya ba'am / gso ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: But people use conventional expressions for the meaning of a definition.🔽In the same way, some understand it as a self.🔽Some understand it as a sentient being.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba'am /🔽skye bu zhes bya ba'am /🔽gang zag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba'am / skye bu zhes bya ba'am / gang zag ces bya ba'am /
translated: Some understand it as a living being.🔽Some understand it as a person.🔽Some understand it as an individual.🔽Some understand it as a human.

original: shed bu zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: shed bu zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Some understand it as a human being.

original: shed las skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: shed las skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or, it is called “born from effort” or “born from action.”

original: skye ba zhes bya ba de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba de lta de ltar bstan cing dpyod pa dang / mngon par zhen pas 'di nyid bden gyi /
translated: In this way, through teaching and investigating, and through attachment, one makes the conventional designation: “This alone is true,

original: gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan ni gti mug pa'o zhes tha snyad du byed mod kyi /
translated: the other is confused.”

original: don ston par bya ba'i phyir byas so zhes tha snyad du byed de /🔽'di tsam gyis na ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i @47a * //
analyzed: don ston par bya ba'i phyir byas so zhes tha snyad du byed de / 'di tsam gyis na ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i @47a * //
translated: But in order to teach the meaning, one makes the conventional designation: “It is made.”

original: tshig la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshig la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, one does not become attached to the definitions of the people of the country,

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la rab tu rgyug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and one does not run after worldly names.

original: ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ljongs kyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not become attached to the definitions of the people of the country,

original: 'jig rten gyi ming la rgyug par mi bya'o zhes /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ming la rgyug par mi bya'o zhes /
translated: and one should not run after worldly names.

original: ngas bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: ngas bstan pa de rgyas par rab tu bshad do //
translated: I have explained in detail what I taught in brief.

original: mdo las dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the sūtras, it is said: “There are twenty-two faculties.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar 'ongs te /
translated: Then the brahmin Śroṇaka by nature went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das dang / lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te /
analyzed: nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das dang / lhan cig yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te /
translated: Having approached, he had various conversations with the Blessed One that were pleasant, delightful, and joyful.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //🔽phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go // phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: He sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the brahmin Śroṇaka said this to the Blessed One:

original: goo ta ma dri ba lung ston pa la skabs 'byed na /
analyzed: goo ta ma dri ba lung ston pa la skabs 'byed na /
translated: Gautama, if you would grant me the opportunity to ask a question,

original: bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dri'o //
analyzed: bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dri'o //
translated: I would like to ask about a few things.

original: bram ze ji ltar 'dod pa dris shig //
analyzed: bram ze ji ltar 'dod pa dris shig //
translated: Brahmin, ask whatever you wish.

original: goo ta ma dbang po dbang po zhes brjod pa dbang po rnams ni du zhig / dbang po rnams dbang po du zhig gis bsdus par gyur /
analyzed: goo ta ma dbang po dbang po zhes brjod pa dbang po rnams ni du zhig / dbang po rnams dbang po du zhig gis bsdus par gyur /
translated: Gautama, when you speak of faculties, how many faculties are there? By how many faculties are the faculties included?

original: bram ze dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: bram ze dbang po nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Brahmin, there are twenty-two faculties.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po dang / rog gi dbang po dang /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / pho'i dbang po dang / rog gi dbang po dang /
translated: The eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the mind faculty, the female faculty, the male faculty, the life faculty,

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: the pleasure faculty, the pain faculty, the mental pleasure faculty, the mental pain faculty, the neutral faculty, the faith faculty, the perseverance faculty, the mindfulness faculty,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: the concentration faculty, the wisdom faculty, the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, the faculty of understanding, and the faculty of one who has understood.

original: bram ze nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag ni dbang po rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bram ze nyi shu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag ni dbang po rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: These twenty-two faculties are called the faculties.

original: 'di tsam gyis na dbang po rnams bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na dbang po rnams bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: This much is the summary of the faculties.

original: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa @47b la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas bram ze rang bzhin nyan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa @47b la mngon par dga' zhing rjes su yi rang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas song ngo //
translated: Then the Brahmin by nature, having rejoiced and delighted in what the Blessed One said, departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi mdo dang sbyar ba'i t'i ka nye bar mkho ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi mdo dang sbyar ba'i t'i ka nye bar mkho ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: In the Abhidharmakośa, the first chapter called The Requisites of Enlightenment is completed.

original: gnas dang po phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba'o /
analyzed: gnas dang po phal cher mdo dang sbyar ba'o /
translated: The first chapter is mostly applied to the sutras.

original: // / mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to abandon what is heard and seen as evil, and so on.

original: mig dang ldan pa dka' ba'i gnas //
analyzed: mig dang ldan pa dka' ba'i gnas //
translated: Having eyes, it is a difficult place.

original: rnam par gnon par byed pa ltar /
analyzed: rnam par gnon par byed pa ltar /
translated: As if subduing,

original: mkhas pas 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //
analyzed: mkhas pas 'tsho ba'i 'jig rten 'dir //
translated: The wise in this world of living

original: sdig pa dag ni yongs su spangs //
analyzed: sdig pa dag ni yongs su spangs //
translated: Completely abandon evil.

original: thos nas chos kun rnams par shes //
analyzed: thos nas chos kun rnams par shes //
translated: Having heard, one fully understands all phenomena.

original: thos nas sdig las 'da' bar byed //
analyzed: thos nas sdig las 'da' bar byed //
translated: Having heard, one transcends evil.

original: thos nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob //
analyzed: thos nas mya ngan las 'das pa thob //
translated: Having heard it, they attain nirvana.🔽

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Having heard it, they attain nirvana.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de'i tshe dri za de sems gnyis po rjes su chags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe dri za de sems gnyis po rjes su chags pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: At that time, the gandharva has two thoughts, one of attachment and so on.

original: phra rgyas btags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba drug pa las mi 'gags shing 'das la /
analyzed: phra rgyas btags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba drug pa las mi 'gags shing 'das la /
translated: The six breaths designated as the negative tendencies are not blocked, but pass through.

original: mngal gyi rkyen ni phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mngal gyi rkyen ni phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The condition for the womb is called distorted and so on.

original: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang don 'di nyid yi ge gzhan du 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang don 'di nyid yi ge gzhan du 'byung ste /
translated: The Descent into the Womb Sutra also explains this meaning with different words:

original: de la 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: It is recited as follows:

original: de la 'di dga' bo ji ltar na sems can ma'i mngal du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'di dga' bo ji ltar na sems can ma'i mngal du 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Nanda, how do sentient beings enter the mother's womb?

original: dga' bo 'di la pha ma chags par 'gyur zhing 'dus pa dang / ma rung zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas na 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo 'di la pha ma chags par 'gyur zhing 'dus pa dang / ma rung zhing zla mtshan dang ldan pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas na 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, when the parents are passionate and unite, when the mother is fertile and ovulating, and when the gandharva is present, entry occurs.

original: dri za zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i sems can gyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: dri za zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i sems can gyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: Gandharva is a synonym for a sentient being in the intermediate state.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The intermediate beings are of two types:

original: kha dog bzang ba dang kha dog ngan pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog bzang ba dang kha dog ngan pa'o //
translated: beautiful and ugly.

original: de la dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma do ni kha dog ngan pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmyal ba'i srid pa bar ma do ni kha dog ngan pa ste /
translated: The intermediate beings of hell are ugly,

original: 'di lta ste ka ba tshig pa lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ka ba tshig pa lta ba'o //
translated: like a burnt log.

original: dud 'gro'i srid pa bar ma do ni du ba'i kha dog lta bu'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i srid pa bar ma do ni du ba'i kha dog lta bu'o //
translated: The intermediate beings of animals are the color of smoke.

original: yi dags kyi ni chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: yi dags kyi ni chu lta bu'o //
translated: The intermediate beings of hungry ghosts are like water.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi dang lha rnams kyi ni gser gyi kha dog go //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i mi dang lha rnams kyi ni gser gyi kha dog go //
translated: The intermediate beings of humans and gods of the realm of desire are the color of gold.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams kyi ni dkar po'o //
translated: The intermediate beings of the realm of fine-materiality are white.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni srid pa bar ma med de ;
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la ni srid pa bar ma med de ;
translated: There is no intermediate existence in the realm of immateriality,

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //🔽srid pa bar ma kha cig ni lag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir ro // srid pa bar ma kha cig ni lag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: because there is no material form there.🔽Some intermediate beings have two arms;

original: kha cig ni rkang pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rkang pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: some have two legs;

original: kha cig ni rkang pa mang po can no //
analyzed: kha cig ni rkang pa mang po can no //
translated: some have many legs;

original: kha cig ni rkang pa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rkang pa gcig pa'o //
translated: some have one leg.

original: 'gro ba gang du sngon gyi las kyis skye bar 'gyur ba srid pa bar ma do'i sems can @48a * //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyus ming dang gzugs /

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rgyus skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rgyus reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rgyus tshor ba /🔽tshor ba'i rgyus srid ba /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rgyus skye mched drug / skye mched drug gi rgyus reg pa / reg pa'i rgyus tshor ba / tshor ba'i rgyus srid ba /

original: srid pa'i rgyus len pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyus len pa /
translated: Due to the cause of feeling, there is craving.

original: len pa'i rgyus srid pa /🔽srid pa'i rgyus skye ba /
analyzed: len pa'i rgyus srid pa / srid pa'i rgyus skye ba /
translated: Due to the cause of craving, there is grasping.🔽Due to the cause of grasping, there is becoming.🔽Due to the cause of becoming, there is birth.

original: skye ba'i rgyus rga shi /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyus rga shi /
translated: Due to the cause of birth, there is old age and death.

original: rga shi'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: rga shi'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba /
translated: Suffering is the cause of aging and death.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i rgyus dad pa dang / tshul khrims yid la byed pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / tshul khrims sdom pa dang / gdung ba rmed pa dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i rgyus dad pa dang / tshul khrims yid la byed pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / tshul khrims sdom pa dang / gdung ba rmed pa dang / dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang /
translated: Faith, attentiveness to ethics, mindfulness, vigilance, restraint of the sense faculties, restraint of ethics, regret, delight, joy,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / skye ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / skye ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: pliancy, bliss, concentration, birth, freedom from attachment and nirvana are the causes of suffering.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: mdo las / bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: Desire increases in relation to the feeling of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Aversion increases in relation to the feeling of pain.

original: ji skad du lung par ma las sdom gyi tshigs su bcas pa gsum pa'i mthar dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo de dang de dag mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
analyzed: ji skad du lung par ma las sdom gyi tshigs su bcas pa gsum pa'i mthar dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo de dang de dag mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
translated: In the Paramarthaśūnyatā-sūtra, the third verse of the three verses of the bhikṣuṇī Dharmadinnā is stated.

original: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang //
translated: The cessation that is due to deliberation

original: bral ba'i so so so so yin //
analyzed: bral ba'i so so so so yin //
translated: is the individual and distinct cessation of each [defilement].

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be understood.

original: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: The unpleasant bodily feeling

original: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is the faculty of pain.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni dbang po lnga'o //
translated: Monks, these are the five faculties:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: bde ba'i po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang // yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang // yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, and the faculty of equanimity.

original: bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /🔽gang bde ba myong ba'i reg pa las skyes ba las dang sems kyis sim pa dang bde ba rig cing myed ba 'di ni bde ba'i @52a * //
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na / gang bde ba myong ba'i reg pa las skyes ba las dang sems kyis sim pa dang bde ba rig cing myed ba 'di ni bde ba'i @52a * //
translated: What is the faculty of pleasure?

original: dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is pleasant, agreeable, and delightful, experienced as bodily well-being, born of contact with the appropriate cause, is called the faculty of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of pain?

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa /
translated: That which is unpleasant, disagreeable, and unpleasurable, experienced as bodily discomfort, born of contact with the inappropriate cause, is called the faculty of pain.

original: lus dang sems kyi sim pa ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi sim pa ma yin zhing sdug bsngal ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po zhes brjod do //
translated: The faculty of suffering is the unpleasant, painful sensation in the body and the mind.

original: yid bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /🔽gang yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: yid bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na / gang yid bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa /
translated: What is the faculty of satisfaction?🔽It is the pleasant, agreeable sensation in the mind born of contact with favorable things.

original: sems kyi sim pa dang bde bar rig cing myong ba 'di nyid yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sim pa dang bde bar rig cing myong ba 'di nyid yid bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the faculty of satisfaction.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of dissatisfaction?🔽It is the unpleasant, disagreeable sensation in the mind born of contact with unfavorable things.

original: yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba 'di ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa sems kyi sim pa ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal ba 'di ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the faculty of dissatisfaction.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of equanimity?

original: btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa lus dang / sems kyi sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rig cing myong ba 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: btang snyoms myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa reg pa las skyes pa lus dang / sems kyi sim pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa rig cing myong ba 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The faculty of equanimity is the experience of equanimity, the contact that is the cause of equanimity, the bodily and mental tranquility that arises from contact, and the sensation that is neither pleasure nor pain, neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med ces bya ba la /
translated: Three are stainless.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The Setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dbang po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three faculties:

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of the capacity for the acquisition of knowledge of what is not yet known, the faculty of knowledge, and the faculty of the possession of knowledge.

original: slob pa slob par byed bzhin pa //🔽drang po'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug //
analyzed: slob pa slob par byed bzhin pa // drang po'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug //
translated: The learner is engaged in learning.🔽He follows the path of the straight.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes mthun pa //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes mthun pa //
translated: He is in accord with the path of the noble ones.

original: rang gi sems ni rjes su srung //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni rjes su srung //
translated: He protects his own mind.

original: 'di zad dang po'i shes pa ste //
analyzed: 'di zad dang po'i shes pa ste //
translated: The exhaustion of this is the first knowledge.

original: de nas kun shes bla ma ste //
analyzed: de nas kun shes bla ma ste //
translated: Then, the knowledge of the superior is the faculty of the possession of knowledge.

original: de nas skyabs la kun shes las //
analyzed: de nas skyabs la kun shes las //
translated: Then, from the knowledge of all the refuges,

original: grol ba'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: grol ba'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The knowledge of liberation from action arises.

original: kun sbyor thams cad zad pa yi //
analyzed: kun sbyor thams cad zad pa yi //
translated: The one who has exhausted all the fetters,

original: mi g-yo rnam par grol ba ni //🔽de yi dbang po phun tshogs shing //
analyzed: mi g-yo rnam par grol ba ni // de yi dbang po phun tshogs shing //
translated: The unshakable one, the liberated one,🔽Has the perfection of the faculties

original: dbang po nye bar zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang po nye bar zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: And has the pacification of the faculties.

original: bdud kyi sde las rnam rgyal zhing //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde las rnam rgyal zhing //
translated: The one who has conquered the army of Mara,

original: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin //
translated: The one who has taken up the last body,

original: zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: Has spoken thus.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par bzhag pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnam par bzhag pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having thus established the noble persons,

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what are the five faculties?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran @52b pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran @52b pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag rno zhing yongs su rdzogs pa na shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po lnga po 'di dag rno zhing yongs su rdzogs pa na shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, when these five faculties are sharp and complete, one becomes an arhat liberated by wisdom.

original: de bas zhan zhing rtul ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas zhan zhing rtul ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are less than that, but still sharp, one becomes a non-returner.

original: de bas rtul zhing zhan pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas rtul zhing zhan pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: When they are less than that, but still sharp, one becomes a follower of faith.

original: dge slong dag gang gi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyogs gcig dang phyogs gcig byed pa ni dbang po lnga po 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gang gi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / phyogs gcig dang phyogs gcig byed pa ni dbang po lnga po 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, because of being complete, making complete, and practicing one part and one part, these five faculties are said to have results.

original: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang la dbang po lnga po 'di dag rnam pa thams cad du thams cad med pa de ni phyi rol so so'i skye bo'i phyogs la gnas par nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I say that one who lacks these five faculties in every way is an outsider, abiding in the class of ordinary beings.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag dbang po lnga ni dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po lnga ni dad pa'i dbang po nas shes rab kyi dbang po'i bar du ste /
translated: The five faculties are the faculty of faith, the faculty of vigor, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dbang po 'di dag che ba dang / rno ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'di dag che ba dang / rno ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have these faculties in a superior and sharp form are called “arhats liberated from both aspects.”

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom ba zhes bya'o //🔽de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o //🔽de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom ba zhes bya'o // de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o // de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have them in a lesser and weaker form are called “arhats liberated by wisdom.”🔽Those who have them in a still lesser and weaker form are called “those who attain nirvana in the interval.”

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who have them in a still lesser and weaker form are called “those who attain nirvana upon rebirth.”

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have them in a still lesser and weaker form are called “those who go upstream.”🔽Those who have them in a still lesser and weaker form are called “those who are liable to fall back.”

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni rigs nas rigs su skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni rigs nas rigs su skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who have them in a still lesser and weaker form are called “those who go from family to family.”

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni mchog tu thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni mchog tu thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are still weaker and less advanced are called “those who are at the most seven times at the most” (saptakṛtvaḥ paramaḥ).

original: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: Those who are still weaker and less advanced are called “those who follow the teachings” (dharmānusārin).

original: / de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas chung zhing zhan pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are still weaker and less advanced are called “those who follow faith” (śraddhānusārin).

original: dge slong dag dbang po'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'bras bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbang po'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'bras bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bhikṣus, based on the perfection of the faculties, one should understand the perfection of the fruits.

original: 'bras bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas dbang po lnga po 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas dbang po lnga po 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Based on the perfection of the fruits, the five faculties become fruitful.

translated: Moreover, the mind and the mental faculty are called consciousness. The childish, ordinary beings who are not learned do not see the disenchantment, detachment, and cessation of this.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ma bshad kyi /

original: 'on kyang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcu bzhir 'gyur bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcu bzhir 'gyur bar bshad do //
translated: However, he explained how those very seven factors of awakening become fourteen by means of different enumerations.

original: khyed cag gi sgrib pa lnga po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcur 'gyur byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcu bzhir 'gyur zhes 'di ltar dris pa na /
analyzed: khyed cag gi sgrib pa lnga po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcur 'gyur byang chub kyi yan lag bdun po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcu bzhir 'gyur zhes 'di ltar dris pa na /
translated: When asked, How do those very five hindrances of yours become ten by means of different enumerations? How do those very seven factors of awakening become fourteen by means of different enumerations?

original: gzhan mu stegs can de dag gzhan dang gzhan gyi phyi rol dag ston pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can de dag gzhan dang gzhan gyi phyi rol dag ston pa 'am /
translated: Those other tīrthikas will teach other and other external things,

original: khro ba'am / zhe sdang ba dang / nga rgyal ba dang / rtsa ba dang / gnod sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / gshe bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro ba'am / zhe sdang ba dang / nga rgyal ba dang / rtsa ba dang / gnod sems dang / mi bzod pa dang / gshe bar byed par 'gyur ro //

original: cang mi smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cang mi smra bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi smra bar zhum zhing 'dug pa dang / dpung po lhod pa dang / kha phyir phyogs pa dang / spro ba med pa dang / mchog tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems kyis gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: They will be silent, discouraged, and listless; they will hang their arms and turn away; they will be without enthusiasm and will remain with their minds in a state of utter lack of composure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dri ba 'di'i lung ston cing sems mgu bar byed par 'gyur ba ngas lhang dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang bcas shing bram ze dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa'i skye dgu dang / lha dang mi'i nang du yang dag par rjes su ma gzigs te /
translated: I do not see in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans, one who could illuminate this question, so that by answering it I might satisfy this young brahmin.

analyzed: gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa 'am 'dir thos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos ni ma gtogs so // dge slong dag sgrib pa lnga po nye bar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Only the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata could illuminate this question, so that by answering it I might satisfy this young brahmin.🔽“Bhikṣus, there are five obscurations and hindrances, and when they are present, the mind is obscured and the wisdom is obscured.

original: sgrib pa lnga po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po de nyid rnam grangs gang gis bcur 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa nye bar bstan par bya ste /

analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa @60a * //

analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa la 'dun pa rnams dang / phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa la 'dun ba'o //

analyzed: de la nang gi bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa la 'dun pa rnams ni sgrib pa ste /
translated: Among them, the obscuration of will for sensual pleasure that is internal is

analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //

original: gang yang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid 'dod pa la 'dun pa de yang sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid 'dod pa la 'dun pa de yang sgrib pa ste /
translated: Also, the obscuration of will for sensual pleasure that is external is

original: mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par sgrib par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par sgrib par byed pa'o //
translated: the non-knowledge that does not understand, and it is the obscuration of what is not nirvana.

analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa nye bar bstan pa rnam grangs 'dis na gnyis su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge slong dag gnod sems kyi sgrib pa bstan par bya ste /

analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis gnod sems kyi sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: gnod sems dang gnod sems kyi rgyu mtshan no //

original: de la gang gnod sems ni sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang gnod sems ni sgrib pa ste /

analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa yang dag bar mi rtogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //

original: gang yang gnod sems kyi rgyu mtshan de yang sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gnod sems kyi rgyu mtshan de yang sgrib pa ste /
translated: Also, the basis of malice is an obscuration

analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa / yang dag par mi rtogs pa /

analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis rmugs pa dang gnyid rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid do //

original: de la rmugs pa ni sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de la rmugs pa ni sgrib pa ste /

analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa /

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //

original: gang yang gnyid de yang mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa /
analyzed: gang yang gnyid de yang mngon par mi shes pa yang dag par mi rtogs pa /

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: and it is the cause for not achieving nirvana.

analyzed: dge slong dag rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa nye bar bstan pa rnam grangs 'dis rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, by this method of teaching the obscurations of drowsiness and sleep, the obscurations of drowsiness and sleep are considered to be two.

analyzed: dge slong dag rgod pa dang 'gyod pa nye bar bstan par bya ste /

original: rnam grangs gang gis rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /

original: de la rgod pa ni sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgod pa ni sgrib pa ste /

analyzed: mngon par mi shes pa / yang dag bar mi rtogs pa /

analyzed: gang yang 'gyod pa de yang sgrib pa ste /

original: dge slong skyes bu mkhas pa kha cig ni dpes bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur bas dpe nyon cig / dge slong sngon byung ba 'dzam bu'i gling gi tshong pa mang po rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i grur zhugs shing pha rol gyi 'gram mthong ba'i bya khyer te
analyzed: dge slong skyes bu mkhas pa kha cig ni dpes bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur bas dpe nyon cig / dge slong sngon byung ba 'dzam bu'i gling gi tshong pa mang po rgya mtsho las brgal ba'i grur zhugs shing pha rol gyi 'gram mthong ba'i bya khyer te
translated: “Monks, some wise people understand the meaning of an explanation through a simile. Monks, listen to the simile. Monks, in the past, many merchants from Jambudvīpa set out to sea in a ship. They took a seagull with them.

original: nor gyi phyir rgya mtsho chen po brgal ba na /🔽ji srid du 'gro ba de srid du pha rol gyi 'gram mthong ba'i bya gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: nor gyi phyir rgya mtsho chen po brgal ba na / ji srid du 'gro ba de srid du pha rol gyi 'gram mthong ba'i bya gtong bar byed do //
translated: They crossed the great ocean for the sake of wealth.🔽As long as they traveled, they released the seagull to see the shore on the other side.

original: gal te pha rol gyi 'gram mthong nas bya de gnas su phyir mi ldog par pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te pha rol gyi 'gram mthong nas bya de gnas su phyir mi ldog par pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar byed do //
translated: If they saw the shore on the other side, the bird would not return to where it was but would go to the shore on the other side.

original: gal te pha rol gyi 'gram ma mthong na bya de de bzhin du gnas su ldog cing pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar mi byed do //🔽de bzhin du dge slong khyod pha rol gyi 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du @65a * //
analyzed: gal te pha rol gyi 'gram ma mthong na bya de de bzhin du gnas su ldog cing pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar mi byed do // de bzhin du dge slong khyod pha rol gyi 'gram ma mthong ba'i bya bzhin du tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du @65a * //
translated: If he does not see the other shore, he will return to his starting point and not go to the other shore.

original: phyin nas lung bstan pa ma thob ste /
analyzed: phyin nas lung bstan pa ma thob ste /
translated: In the same way, monk, you have gone as far as the Brahma world without obtaining a prophecy, like a bird that does not see the other shore.

original: slar nga'i drung du 'ongs so //
analyzed: slar nga'i drung du 'ongs so //
translated: You have come back to me.

original: 'on kyang dge slong dri ba 'di 'di lta bur dri bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang dge slong dri ba 'di 'di lta bur dri bar mi bya zhing /
translated: However, monk, this question should not be asked in this way.

original: dri ba 'di 'di lta bur 'dri na yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri ba 'di 'di lta bur 'dri na yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this question were asked in this way, it would not be fully answered.

original: ji ltar dri ba dri bar bya ba dang / ji ltar dri ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dri ba dri bar bya ba dang / ji ltar dri ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, I will explain how the question should be asked and how the question should be fully answered.

original: gang du sa chu me dang ni //
analyzed: gang du sa chu me dang ni //
translated: Where earth, water, fire and wind

original: rlung dag rjes su mi 'jug dang // gang du ring dang thung ba dang // phra sbom dge dang mi dge dang // gang du ming dang gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rlung dag rjes su mi 'jug dang // gang du ring dang thung ba dang // phra sbom dge dang mi dge dang // gang du ming dang gzugs dag ni //
translated: The winds do not blow,🔽and there is no long or short, no subtle or coarse, no good or bad,

original: ma lus pa dag 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma lus pa dag 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: where name and form cease without remainder.

original: de la ji lta ji ltar chos rnam par shes nas lung bstan par 'gyur ba 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de la ji lta ji ltar chos rnam par shes nas lung bstan par 'gyur ba 'gog pa ste /
translated: As the Dharma is cognized in this way, the cessation that is to be declared is as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa bstan du med pa mtha' yas pa thams cad du khyab cing khyab pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bstan du med pa mtha' yas pa thams cad du khyab cing khyab pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: All the imperceptible and infinite consciousnesses that pervade and are pervasive do not arise.

original: 'on kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung yang 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, earth, water, fire, and wind do not function.

original: ring ba dang thung du dang / phra ba dang / spom pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / ming dang gzugs ma lus pa yang 'dir 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring ba dang thung du dang / phra ba dang / spom pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / ming dang gzugs ma lus pa yang 'dir 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Long and short, subtle and coarse, good and bad, and all name and form cease here.

original: btsun pa dge slong de'i ming ci yin //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong de'i ming ci yin //
translated: What is the name of that venerable monk?

original: khyim bdag gi bu rta thul zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu rta thul zhes bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied, “He is called the householder’s son Aśvajit.”

original: bdag la ltos nas nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag la ltos nas nyes pa rnams kyis mi 'dzem pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to not shunning faults in relation to oneself, etc.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of mastery:

original: dbang du bya ba gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of mastery?

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba dang / bdag gi dbang du bya ba dang / chos kyi dbang du bya ba'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba dang / bdag gi dbang du bya ba dang / chos kyi dbang du bya ba'o /
translated: Mastery over the world, mastery over oneself, and mastery over the Dharma.

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang du bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is mastery over the world?

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa'am /
translated: Here, a noble disciple trains like this in a wilderness,

original: shing drud dam /
analyzed: shing drud dam /
translated: or at the foot of a tree,

original: khad pa stong par 'di ltar yang dag par bslab ste /🔽'jig rten 'di ni rab tu mang ngo //
analyzed: khad pa stong par 'di ltar yang dag par bslab ste / 'jig rten 'di ni rab tu mang ngo //
translated: or in an empty building, thinking:🔽'The worlds are many.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i dbyibs ni rab tu mang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i dbyibs ni rab tu mang ngo //
translated: The shapes of the worlds are many.

original: 'jig rten rab tu mang po dang / 'jig rten gyi dbyibs rab tu mang po 'di ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba lha'i mig dang / gzhan gyi sems ring po na 'dug pa mthong zhing de dag gis de mi mthong ba sems kyis sems la khyab par byas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rab tu mang po dang / 'jig rten gyi dbyibs rab tu mang po 'di ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba lha'i mig dang / gzhan gyi sems ring po na 'dug pa mthong zhing de dag gis de mi mthong ba sems kyis sems la khyab par byas te /
translated: There are many worlds and many world-systems. This is the supernormal power of those who have attained the superknowledges, who have great power, who have the divine eye, who see far away, who see the minds of others, and who, when they do not see, pervade the mind with the mind.

original: yid kyis yid rab tu shes pa yod do //
analyzed: yid kyis yid rab tu shes pa yod do //
translated: There are those who know the mind through the mind.

original: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba lha'i mig dang / gzhan gyi sems shes @65b pas ring po na 'dug pa mthong zhing de dag gis de mi mthong ba sems kyis sems la khyab par byas te yid kyis yid rab tu shes pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'di na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba lha'i mig dang / gzhan gyi sems shes @65b pas ring po na 'dug pa mthong zhing de dag gis de mi mthong ba sems kyis sems la khyab par byas te yid kyis yid rab tu shes pa yang yod do //
translated: There are the disciples of the Blessed One who have attained the superknowledges, who have great power, who have the divine eye, who see far away, who see the minds of others, and who, when they do not see, pervade the mind with the mind.🔽They know the mind through the mind.

original: gal te nga chags sems dang 'dres pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed na des bdag shis shing des bdag mthong par 'gyur la shes shing mthong nas brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nga chags sems dang 'dres pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed na des bdag shis shing des bdag mthong par 'gyur la shes shing mthong nas brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were to think with thoughts of desire and attachment, they would know me and see me.

original: rigs kyi bu khyim nas khyim med par dad pas rab tu byung nas chags sems dang 'dres pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed do zhes mthong zhing smra bar 'gyur ro //
