analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyim nas khyim med par dad pas rab tu byung nas chags sems dang 'dres pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed do zhes mthong zhing smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having known and seen me, they would say, ‘Son of a good family, you have gone forth from home into homelessness with faith, but you think with thoughts of desire and attachment, which are evil and unwholesome.’🔽They would see and say that.

original: gang yang de dag gis bdag shes shing gang yang de dag gis bdag mthong la /
analyzed: gang yang de dag gis bdag shes shing gang yang de dag gis bdag mthong la /
translated: And they would know me and see me.

original: gang yang bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid shes shing bdag nyid mthong bas /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid shes shing bdag nyid mthong bas /
translated: And I would know and see myself by myself.

original: gang yang bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid shes shing bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid mthong la rnam par shes so zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid shes shing bdag gi bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid mthong la rnam par shes so zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And I would know and see myself by myself, and I would say, ‘I know and see by myself.’

original: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowing and seeing thus, he exerts himself with vigor.

original: mi zhum pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not discouraged, and his body becomes fit and ready for action. He is mindful and attentive.

original: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: He is aware, his mind is concentrated, and he is one-pointed.

original: de 'jig rten nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de 'jig rten nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: This is called the mundane.

original: mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgom par 'gyur te /
translated: He abandons the unwholesome and develops the wholesome.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mundane.

original: bdag gi dbang du byas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du byas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane?

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa 'am /
translated: Here a noble disciple,🔽whether in the forest,

original: shing drung ngam khang pa stong par 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su slob ste /
analyzed: shing drung ngam khang pa stong par 'di ltar yang dag par rjes su slob ste /
translated: at the foot of a tree, or in an empty building,

original: dgon pa dben pa de dang der skad cig skad cig gis rtogs pa khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgon pa dben pa de dang der skad cig skad cig gis rtogs pa khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: in a moment of insight attains a higher stage.

original: gal te bdag chags sems dang 'dres pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed pa na /
analyzed: gal te bdag chags sems dang 'dres pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed pa na /
translated: If he thinks thoughts that are mixed with attachment,🔽he sees that they are not in accord with the Dharma and that he does not understand such a Dharma.

original: de dag gi tshul dang mi mthun zhing chos 'di lta bu rnam par mi shes so zhes de de ltar mthong nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de dag gi tshul dang mi mthun zhing chos 'di lta bu rnam par mi shes so zhes de de ltar mthong nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Having seen this, he exerts himself,

original: / mi zhum pa dang lus shin du sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / mi zhum pa dang lus shin du sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: without being discouraged, with physical pliancy, with a mind that is alert, with mindfulness that is well-established,

original: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang / rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang / rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: with introspection, with a mind that is concentrated, and with one-pointedness.🔽He cultivates virtue and abandons evil,

original: de bdag gi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba bsgom par 'gyur te /🔽'di ni bdag gi dbang du @66a * //
analyzed: de bdag gi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba bsgom par 'gyur te / 'di ni bdag gi dbang du @66a * //
translated: having made himself the authority.

original: bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “making oneself the authority.”

original: chos kyi dbang du bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is “making the Dharma the authority”?

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa'am shing drung ngam khang pa stong bar 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos dgon pa'am shing drung ngam khang pa stong bar 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Here, a noble disciple trains like this:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One’s Dharma is well-spoken,

original: yang dag par mthong ba /
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba /
translated: it is to be seen for oneself,

original: nad med pa /
analyzed: nad med pa /
translated: it is free from disease,

original: dus chad pa med pa /
analyzed: dus chad pa med pa /
translated: it is timeless,

original: nye bar gtod pa /
analyzed: nye bar gtod pa /
translated: it is a guide,

original: 'di mthong ba la don yod pa /
analyzed: 'di mthong ba la don yod pa /
translated: it is meaningful to behold,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba ste /
translated: and it is to be personally experienced by the wise.

original: gal te bdag chags sems dang 'dres pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed na /
analyzed: gal te bdag chags sems dang 'dres pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtog par byed na /
translated: If I were to think with a mind full of attachment, that would be a sinful, unwholesome thought.🔽If I were to think in that way, it would not be in accord with my way of life and I would not understand such a Dharma.

original: de bdag gi tshul dang mi mthun zhing chos 'di lta bu rnam par mi shes so zhes de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bdag gi tshul dang mi mthun zhing chos 'di lta bu rnam par mi shes so zhes de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were to know and see in this way, I would be diligent.

original: mi zhum pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang brtun zhing dran pa nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: I would not be discouraged, my body would be pliant, I would be steadfast, and I would establish mindfulness.

original: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par gzhog pa dang rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes bzhin dang sems mnyam par gzhog pa dang rtse gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: I would be alert, my mind would be in equipoise, and I would be one-pointed.

original: de chos kyi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de chos kyi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong ba dang dge ba bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taken the Dharma as my object, I would abandon unwholesomeness and cultivate virtue.”

original: 'di ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya'o //🔽sdig pa'i las rnams byed pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya'o // sdig pa'i las rnams byed pa la //
translated: This is called the Dharma.

original: dben pa'i gnas ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: dben pa'i gnas ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no solitary place for those who do evil.

original: bden nam yang na brdzun yang rung //
analyzed: bden nam yang na brdzun yang rung //
translated: Whether true or false,

original: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni rnam par shes //
translated: one knows it oneself.

original: bdag nyid pha rol brnyas mi byed //
analyzed: bdag nyid pha rol brnyas mi byed //
translated: One should not despise oneself or others.

original: dbang po'i mchog ni 'di yin te //🔽bdag la yod pa'i sdig pa dag //
analyzed: dbang po'i mchog ni 'di yin te // bdag la yod pa'i sdig pa dag //
translated: This is the supreme sense.

original: rab tu gsang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not keep one’s evil deeds secret.

original: 'jig rten byis pa rnams ni dkar spyod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten byis pa rnams ni dkar spyod pa //
translated: The childish in the world are white-clad,

original: lha dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs //
analyzed: lha dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs //
translated: seen by gods and tathāgatas.

original: blo dang dran ldan 'jig rten 'di nyid kyi //
analyzed: blo dang dran ldan 'jig rten 'di nyid kyi //
translated: The wise and mindful, in this very world,

original: dbang du byas te bdag gi sdig pa spong //
analyzed: dbang du byas te bdag gi sdig pa spong //
translated: overcome and abandon their own evil.

original: chos spyod bden pa pha rol gnon pa yi //
analyzed: chos spyod bden pa pha rol gnon pa yi //
translated: Practicing the Dharma, truthful and resolute,

original: thub pa chos kyi dbang byas nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: thub pa chos kyi dbang byas nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: the Sage, having mastered the Dharma, does not decline.

original: gang zhig bdud spangs gshin rje rab bcom zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig bdud spangs gshin rje rab bcom zhing //
translated: One who abandons Māra, conquers Yama,🔽and possesses abandonment, touches the end of birth.

original: spangs par ldan pa skye ba zad la reg / de ni zhi zhing 'dod pa sdig pa spangs //
analyzed: spangs par ldan pa skye ba zad la reg / de ni zhi zhing 'dod pa sdig pa spangs //
translated: That one is peaceful, having abandoned desire and evil.

original: skye dang rga las brgal bar nga smra'o //
analyzed: skye dang rga las brgal bar nga smra'o //
translated: I declare that they are beyond birth and aging.

original: zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: I declare that one has transcended birth and aging.

original: mdo las rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa yin par gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag ni ngag mngon par 'du byed pa yin par gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sutra states that investigation and analysis are the formative factors of speech.

original: gang las bshad ce na /
analyzed: gang las bshad ce na /
translated: From what sutra is this stated?

original: dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo sngar bshad pa dang / 'dod pa can gyi mdo las nye bar bstan pa ma byas par @66b bshad do //
analyzed: dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo sngar bshad pa dang / 'dod pa can gyi mdo las nye bar bstan pa ma byas par @66b bshad do //
translated: It is explained in the sutra of Bhikshuni Dharmadinna explained above and in the sutra of the desirous one, but it is not taught in the sutra of the desirous one.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Consciousness is consciousness.

original: mdzod kyi gnas dang por phung po las sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i mtha'i mdo las gzugs su rung bas na gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas dang por phung po las sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i mtha'i mdo las gzugs su rung bas na gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: In the first chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, it is taught in the sutra at the end of the verse summarizing the aggregates that form is that which can be formed, and so on.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These are the ten dharmas of no more learning.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The nidana is in Shravasti.

original: dge slong dag bcu po 'di dag ni mi slob pa'i chos te /
analyzed: dge slong dag bcu po 'di dag ni mi slob pa'i chos te /
translated: Bhikshus, these ten are the dharmas of no more learning.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ; yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang ; yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: The right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: right concentration, right liberation, and right wisdom of one beyond training.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di bskyed cing thob la kun tu ldan pas na yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa'i 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu po 'di bskyed cing thob la kun tu ldan pas na yan lag lnga rnam par spangs pa'i 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes an arya who has abandoned five branches by generating and attaining these ten dharmas of one beyond training and possessing them.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / bsrung ba gcig pa dang / brten pa bzhi dang / rang sangs rgyas las rab tu 'das pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs pa dang /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / bsrung ba gcig pa dang / brten pa bzhi dang / rang sangs rgyas las rab tu 'das pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / lus kyi 'du byed shin tu sbyangs pa dang /
translated: One possesses six branches, has one protection, has four supports, has transcended pratyekabuddhas, has abandoned origin, is without conceptuality, has purified physical compositional factors,

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa dang / skyes bu'i mchog ces bya ba'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / gcig tu tshangs par spyod pa dang / skyes bu'i mchog ces bya ba'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: and is called the supreme person.

original: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor los sgyur ba rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Monks, a wheel-turning king possesses the seven treasures.

original: lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las rgyas pa byis pa dang mkhas pa'i mdo las 'don te /
analyzed: lung bar ma'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa las rgyas pa byis pa dang mkhas pa'i mdo las 'don te /
translated: The second verse of the intermediate summary is recited in the sutra on the childish and the wise:

original: de lus kyis legs par spyad pa spyad /
analyzed: de lus kyis legs par spyad pa spyad /
translated: He practices good conduct with the body,🔽good conduct with speech and mind.

original: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig pa'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pa spyad nas de'i rgyu dang de'i rkyen gyis lus zhig pa'i 'og tu bde 'gro mtho ris kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that cause and that condition, after the body breaks up, he is reborn in a good realm, in the world of the gods.

original: dge slong dag gang yang yang dag par smra bas smra ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang yang yang dag par smra bas smra ste /
translated: Monks, one who speaks correctly would say:

original: dben pa ni 'dod pa /🔽dben pa ni sdug pa /🔽dben pa ni dga' ba /
analyzed: dben pa ni 'dod pa / dben pa ni sdug pa / dben pa ni dga' ba /
translated: Seclusion is desirable,🔽seclusion is lovely,🔽seclusion is delightful,

original: dben pa ni yid du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: dben pa ni yid du 'ong ba ste /
translated: seclusion is pleasing.

original: mtho ris so zhes zer ba de ni yang dag par smra bas smra ba ste /
analyzed: mtho ris so zhes zer ba de ni yang dag par smra bas smra ba ste /
translated: Those who say the higher realms are speaking correctly.

original: dge slong dag mtho ris ni 'dod pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag mtho ris ni 'dod pa /
translated: Monks, the higher realms are desirable.

original: mtho ris ni sdug pa /🔽mtho ris ni dga' ba /🔽mtho ris @67a * //
analyzed: mtho ris ni sdug pa / mtho ris ni dga' ba / mtho ris @67a * //
translated: The higher realms are beautiful.🔽The higher realms are delightful.

original: ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: ni yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The higher realms are pleasing.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
translated: Then another monk rose from his seat, adjusted his upper robe on one shoulder,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar te /
translated: placed his palms together toward the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa mtho ris ci tsam du bde /
analyzed: btsun pa mtho ris ci tsam du bde /
translated: Venerable One, how blissful are the higher realms?

original: dge slong ngas khyod kyis sla bar rtogs pa'i phyir bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ngas khyod kyis sla bar rtogs pa'i phyir bshad par bya'o //
translated: Monks, I will explain this for you to easily understand.

original: btsun pa dpe cung zhig mchis sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dpe cung zhig mchis sam /
translated: Venerable One, is there any analogy?

original: dge slong yod do //
analyzed: dge slong yod do //
translated: Monks, there is.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to that monk,

original: dge slong 'di lta ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong 'di lta ste 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
translated: Monks, it is like this: a universal monarch possesses the seven precious substances.

original: mi bzhi po thams cad kyi dbang phyug thob pa /
analyzed: mi bzhi po thams cad kyi dbang phyug thob pa /
translated: All four of them had attained lordship.

original: gling bzhi'i rgyal po dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag po byed pa mchog tu bde ba dang ldan nam /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i rgyal po dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag po byed pa mchog tu bde ba dang ldan nam /
translated: Were they supremely happy and joyful, being kings of the four continents, lords, and masters?

original: yid bde ba dang ldan nam /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang ldan nam /
translated: Were they happy and joyful?

original: btsun pa re zhig rin po che gcig dang ldan pa dang / mi gcig la dbang ba dang / gling gcig gi rgyal po dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag po byed pa yang mchog tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan na /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig rin po che gcig dang ldan pa dang / mi gcig la dbang ba dang / gling gcig gi rgyal po dang / dbang phyug dang / bdag po byed pa yang mchog tu bde ba dang yid bde ba dang ldan na /
translated: Venerable One, if someone who has just one jewel, who has power over just one person, who is king of just one continent, and who is a lord and master is supremely happy and joyful,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to speak of a universal monarch?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sen mo'i rtse mor rdul gcig bsnams te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sen mo'i rtse mor rdul gcig bsnams te /
translated: Then the Blessed One took a speck of dust on the tip of his nail

original: dge slong de la bos te dge slong 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽nga'i sen mo'i rtse mo la yod pa'i rdul 'di mang ngam /
analyzed: dge slong de la bos te dge slong 'di ji snyam du sems / nga'i sen mo'i rtse mo la yod pa'i rdul 'di mang ngam /
translated: and addressed the monk, “Monk, what do you think?🔽Is the speck of dust on the tip of my nail more,

original: sa chen po la gnas pa'i rdul gang mang /
analyzed: sa chen po la gnas pa'i rdul gang mang /
translated: or is the dust that exists on the great earth more?”

original: btsun pa sen mo'i rtse mo la yod pa'i rdul 'di nyung zhing rab tu nyung la shin tu rab tu nyung ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sen mo'i rtse mo la yod pa'i rdul 'di nyung zhing rab tu nyung la shin tu rab tu nyung ste /
translated: Venerable, the dust on the tip of a fingernail is small, very small, extremely small.

original: bcom ldan 'das sa chen po'i rdul gyi dper yang mi 'gro la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sa chen po'i rdul gyi dper yang mi 'gro la /
translated: It does not even serve as an analogy for the dust on the great earth.

original: brgya'i char yang /🔽stong gi char yang /
analyzed: brgya'i char yang / stong gi char yang /
translated: It is not even a hundredth,🔽not even a thousandth,

original: brgya stong gi char yan /
analyzed: brgya stong gi char yan /
translated: not even a hundred thousandth.

original: grangs su yang /🔽bgrang bar yang /
analyzed: grangs su yang / bgrang bar yang /
translated: It is not even a number,🔽not even a fraction,🔽not even a similarity,

original: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: not even a comparison.

original: dge slong ji ltar sen mo'i rtse mo la brten pa'i rdul sa chen po la brten pa'i rdul gyi dper yang nye bar mi 'gro la /🔽brgya'i char yang /
analyzed: dge slong ji ltar sen mo'i rtse mo la brten pa'i rdul sa chen po la brten pa'i rdul gyi dper yang nye bar mi 'gro la / brgya'i char yang /
translated: Bhikṣus, just as the dust on the tip of a fingernail in comparison to the dust on the great earth does not even serve as an analogy,🔽it is not even a hundredth,

original: stong gi char yang /
analyzed: stong gi char yang /
translated: not even a thousandth,

original: brgya stong gi char yang /
analyzed: brgya stong gi char yang /
translated: not even a hundred thousandth.

original: grangs su yang /
analyzed: grangs su yang /
translated: It is not even a number,🔽not even a fraction,🔽not even a similarity,

original: bgrang bar yang /
analyzed: bgrang bar yang /
translated: not even a comparison.

original: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa /
translated: In the same way, a universal monarch who possesses the seven treasures

original: gling bzhi'i dbang phyug dang / rgyal po dang / bdag po byed pa'i bde ba de lha'i bde ba'i dper yang mi 'gro la /🔽brgya'i char yang /🔽stong gi char yang /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i dbang phyug dang / rgyal po dang / bdag po byed pa'i bde ba de lha'i bde ba'i dper yang mi 'gro la / brgya'i char yang / stong gi char yang /
translated: The happiness of being a lord of the four continents, a king, or a master does not even serve as an analogy for the happiness of the gods.🔽It does not approach even a hundredth part,🔽a thousandth part,

original: brgya stong gi char yang /🔽grangs su yang /
analyzed: brgya stong gi char yang / grangs su yang /
translated: a hundred thousandth part,🔽a count,

original: bgrang @67b bar yang /
analyzed: bgrang @67b bar yang /
translated: a fraction,

original: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper yang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: an analogy, or a comparison.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bya ba'i mtho ris yod de /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug ces bya ba'i mtho ris yod de /
translated: There is a higher rebirth called the six sense sources of contact.

original: der skyes pa'i sems can de dag mig gis gzugs gang mthong ba yid du 'ong ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: der skyes pa'i sems can de dag mig gis gzugs gang mthong ba yid du 'ong ba mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The sentient beings who are born there see only forms with the eyes that are attractive,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba mthong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: not unattractive.

original: yid dga' bar 'gyur gyi mi dga' bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid dga' bar 'gyur gyi mi dga' bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They experience only mental joy, not mental unhappiness.

original: dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: They experience only pleasant forms,

original: mi dga' ba'i gzugs su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i gzugs su mi 'gyur /
translated: not unpleasant forms.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi mi dga' ba'i gzugs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi mi dga' ba'i gzugs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: They experience only delightful forms, not forms that are not delightful.

original: de'i rgyus gcig tu bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyus gcig tu bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this, they experience only happiness and mental pleasure.

original: rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnam par shes na yid du 'ong ba shes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rna bas sgra dang / snas dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnam par shes na yid du 'ong ba shes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When they cognize a sound with their ears, a smell with their nose, a taste with their tongue, a tactile object with their body, or a phenomenon with their mind, they cognize what is pleasant,

original: yid du mi 'ong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba ma yin la /
translated: not what is unpleasant.

original: dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: They experience a form that is delightful,

original: mi dga' ba'i gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i gzugs ma yin no //
translated: not a form that is not delightful.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gzugs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: They experience a form that is very delightful,

original: rab tu mi dga' ba'i gzugs ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu mi dga' ba'i gzugs ma yin te /
translated: not a form that is not very delightful.

original: de'i rgyus gcig tu bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyus gcig tu bde ba dang yid bde ba so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of this, they experience only happiness and mental pleasure.

original: dge slong gal te mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can de gnas de las gal te /
analyzed: dge slong gal te mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can de gnas de las gal te /
translated: “Monks, if those who are wise by nature, in that situation,

original: 'chi 'pho zhing 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ong na yang rigs gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba dang / bdog pa mang ba dang / rang dbang dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho zhing 'dir mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ong na yang rigs gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phyug cing nor mang la longs spyod che ba dang / bdog pa mang ba dang / rang dbang dang bcas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: And even if they die and come here to be reborn among humans, they will be born into a family that is wealthy, with much wealth and property, with many possessions, and with independence.

original: nor dang 'bru dang / rin po che dang / gser gyi mdzod gang ba dang / bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang ba dang / grogs po dang mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams mang bar 'gyur ba de lta bu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang / rin po che dang / gser gyi mdzod gang ba dang / bran pho dang bran mo dang las byed pa'i skyes bu mang ba dang / grogs po dang mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams mang bar 'gyur ba de lta bu dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born into a family that has many treasuries and storehouses filled with grain, jewels, and gold, many male and female servants and workers, and many friends, loved ones, relatives, and family members.

original: thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Obtaining what is obtained” means:

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The introductory story is that this took place in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag chos gcig dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa'i skal ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gcig dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa'i skal ba med de /
translated: Monks, if you have one thing, you are not fortunate enough to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: 'di lta ste ma rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rnyed pa'o //
translated: It is non-acquisition.

original: dge slong dag ma rnyed pa dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rnyed pa dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal ba med do //
translated: Bhiksus, if one possesses non-acquisition, one does not have the fortune to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: dge slong dag chos gcig dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa'i skal pa yod de rnyed pa'o //🔽rnyed pa dang ldan na dran pa nye @68a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag chos gcig dang ldan na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom pa'i skal pa yod de rnyed pa'o // rnyed pa dang ldan na dran pa nye @68a * //
translated: Bhiksus, if one possesses one thing, one has the fortune to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, which is acquisition.

original: bar bzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal pa yod do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bar bzhag pa bzhi bsten pa'i skal pa yod do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: If one possesses acquisition, one has the fortune to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brgya la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ong na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brgya la mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ong na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One also said, If one comes to have the same fortune as humans, etc.

original: ji ltar re zhig byis pa dang mkhas pa'i mdo las go rims las bzlog ste gnyis par bshad pa lta bu dang / de'i rjes thogs la tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig byis pa dang mkhas pa'i mdo las go rims las bzlog ste gnyis par bshad pa lta bu dang / de'i rjes thogs la tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, just as in the Sūtra on the Child and the Wise, the order is reversed and explained as second, and immediately after that, it is recited in that Sūtra on the Net of Brahma as it is recited there.

original: mdo las sems can de dag yun ring por 'dug ste 'du shes skyes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las sems can de dag yun ring por 'dug ste 'du shes skyes nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those sentient beings remain for a long time and when discernment arises...

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po'i zhabs su tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad pa dang / mdzod kyi gnas gsum par lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ji ltar tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad pa der 'don pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po'i zhabs su tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad pa dang / mdzod kyi gnas gsum par lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ji ltar tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad pa der 'don pa lta bu ste /
translated: The bases of the aggregate of ethics explain the net of Brahma and the third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa lists the sixty two views as they are explained in the net of Brahma.

original: dge slong dag dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig sngon gyi mtha'i skal par 'di lta ste dngos po gnyis po bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing rgyu med pa las skyes par smra zhing mngon par smra da dag yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig sngon gyi mtha'i skal par 'di lta ste dngos po gnyis po bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing rgyu med pa las skyes par smra zhing mngon par smra da dag yod de /
translated: Bhikshus, some sramanas and brahmans say that the world and the self are without cause and arise without a cause.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze de dag gang zhig rtogs shing gang la brten nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze de dag gang zhig rtogs shing gang la brten nas 'di lta ste /
translated: What do those sramanas and brahmans realize and on what do they rely in order to say this?

original: dngos po gnyis po bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing rgyu med pa las skye bar mngon par smra zhing smra zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis po bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing rgyu med pa las skye bar mngon par smra zhing smra zhe na /
translated: If you say that both things, the self and the world, arise without a cause and are produced without a cause,

original: dge slong dag gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa'i sems can zhes bya ba'i lha yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa'i sems can zhes bya ba'i lha yod de /
translated: “Monks, there are gods called ‘beings without ideation’ in the form realm.

original: yang sems can de dag 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang sems can de dag 'du shes skyes nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when ideation arises in those beings, they die and pass away from that state.

original: de nas sems can gzhan zhig tshe zad de las zad de gnas de nas 'chi 'phos te brgyal mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ongs te /
analyzed: de nas sems can gzhan zhig tshe zad de las zad de gnas de nas 'chi 'phos te brgyal mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa 'di lta bu nyid du 'ongs te /
translated: Then, another being, whose lifespan and karma are exhausted, dies and passes away from that state and comes to this very world, to the same fortune as humans.

original: cher skyes shing /
analyzed: cher skyes shing /
translated: He grows to maturity,

original: dbang po yongs su smin nas skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos bgos shing dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung nas de dgon pa'am shing drung ngam /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin nas skra dang kha spu bregs te chos gos bgos shing dad pas yang dag pa kho nar khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung nas de dgon pa'am shing drung ngam /
translated: shaves his head and face, puts on the orange robes, and with faith goes forth from the household life into homelessness. He goes to the wilderness, to the foot of a tree, or into an empty dwelling.

original: khang pa stong par yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu dang / spangs pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyu dang yang dag par yid la byas pa'i rgyus ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa sngon gyi 'du shes skyes pa rjes su dran pa sems de lta bur zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong ste /
analyzed: khang pa stong par yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu dang / spangs pa'i rgyu dang / lan mang du byas pa'i rgyu dang yang dag par yid la byas pa'i rgyus ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa sngon gyi 'du shes skyes pa rjes su dran pa sems de lta bur zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mthong ste /
translated: “The cause of complete anguish in an empty house, the cause of abandonment, the cause of frequent practice, and the cause of correct mental attention, the mind that has been thus concentrated sees the arising of the prior perception that is recalled.

original: de 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'gyur te /
translated: “He thinks as follows:

original: bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las rab tu byung la /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las rab tu byung la /
translated: ‘I and this world have arisen without a cause.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las rab tu skyes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las rab tu skyes so //
translated: Similarly, I and this world have been born without a cause.

original: bdag sngon ma byung @68b la da ltar yang dag par byung zhis dge slong dang po'i dngos po gang rtogs shing gang la brten zhing gang zhig dmigs nas sngon gyi mtha'i bskal par bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med
analyzed: bdag sngon ma byung @68b la da ltar yang dag par byung zhis dge slong dang po'i dngos po gang rtogs shing gang la brten zhing gang zhig dmigs nas sngon gyi mtha'i bskal par bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las byung zhing bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med
translated: “‘I did not exist before, but now I have come into existence. What is the state of a monk that I have realized? What do I rely on? What do I observe? Having observed the eon of the past, I and this world have arisen without a cause. I and this world have arisen without a cause.

original: pa las skyes so zhes mngon par smra zhing mngon par smra'o //
analyzed: pa las skyes so zhes mngon par smra zhing mngon par smra'o //
translated: and it is from that that I was born.

original: re zhig skyil mo krung mi bshig go snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di mi ldang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: re zhig skyil mo krung mi bshig go snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di mi ldang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because the thought that he would not break his cross-legged posture had not arisen.

original: dge 'dun dbyen gyi gzhi'i mdo drug pa'i gzhi las 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: dge 'dun dbyen gyi gzhi'i mdo drug pa'i gzhi las 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: The Sūtra on the Basis of the Schism in the Saṅgha states:

original: byang chub sems dpa' klu'i rgyal po nag po yang dag par bstod nas rdo rje'i gdan du mngon par phyogs te bzhugs nas de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' klu'i rgyal po nag po yang dag par bstod nas rdo rje'i gdan du mngon par phyogs te bzhugs nas de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The bodhisattva, the nāga king Kālika, having praised the Buddha, sat facing the vajra seat and thought,🔽“I will sit on a spread of grass.”

original: rtsva bting ba la 'dug par bya'o zhes rtog cing rtsva dgos pa na lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs sems kyis shes nas spos kyi ri las reg na 'jam pa'i rtsva khur du blangs te bdag nyid rtsva 'tshong bkra shis kyi gzugs su
analyzed: rtsva bting ba la 'dug par bya'o zhes rtog cing rtsva dgos pa na lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i thugs sems kyis shes nas spos kyi ri las reg na 'jam pa'i rtsva khur du blangs te bdag nyid rtsva 'tshong bkra shis kyi gzugs su
translated: When he needed grass, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, knowing the bodhisattva’s thoughts, took a load of soft grass from a fragrant mountain and, manifesting himself in the form of the auspicious grass merchant,

original: mngon par sprul nas byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du 'dug go //
analyzed: mngon par sprul nas byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du 'dug go //
translated: sat in front of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva said:🔽“Give me the grass, O very good-faced one!”

original: rab tu bzang po'i gdong pa bdag la rtsva byin cig / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs la gtugs te gus pa dang bcas pas phul lo //
analyzed: rab tu bzang po'i gdong pa bdag la rtsva byin cig / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs la gtugs te gus pa dang bcas pas phul lo //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, bowed down at the Bodhisattva’s feet and respectfully offered it to him.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpas rtsva 'tshong bkra shis las rtsva blangs nas lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i lam nas byang chub kyi shing drung du nye bar gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpas rtsva 'tshong bkra shis las rtsva blangs nas lhas byin gyis brlabs pa'i lam nas byang chub kyi shing drung du nye bar gshegs so //
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, having taken the grass from the auspicious grass seller, went to the foot of the Bodhi tree by the path consecrated by Devadatta.

original: nye bar gshegs nas ma 'dres shing ma 'dres pa'i rtsva'i stan 'ding bar rtsom pa na /
analyzed: nye bar gshegs nas ma 'dres shing ma 'dres pa'i rtsva'i stan 'ding bar rtsom pa na /
translated: Having arrived, he began to spread out the unmixed and unadulterated grass seat.

original: de nas rtsva de dag ma 'dres par lhung bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: de nas rtsva de dag ma 'dres par lhung bar gyur pa na /
translated: Then that grass fell down unmixed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du /
translated: The Bodhisattva thought this:

original: ji ltar rtsva 'di dag lhung ba las na bdag nges par bla na med pa'i ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva 'di dag lhung ba las na bdag nges par bla na med pa'i ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Just as this grass has fallen down, so I will surely realize unsurpassed wisdom.

original: de nas rdo rje'i gdan na klu'i rgyal po ltar sku bskyil te skyil mo krung bcas te sku drang por bsrangs nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mngon du phyogs shing sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang brjod pa /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i gdan na klu'i rgyal po ltar sku bskyil te skyil mo krung bcas te sku drang por bsrangs nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mngon du phyogs shing sems bskyed cing tshig tu yang brjod pa /
translated: Then, like a naga king at Bodhgaya, he sat cross legged, straightened his body and, with mindfulness directed to the present, generated bodhicitta and said:

original: ji srid du zag pa med pa ma thob kyi bar du skyil mo krung 'di mi bshig par bya'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji srid du zag pa med pa ma thob kyi bar du skyil mo krung 'di mi bshig par bya'o zhes brjod do //
translated: Until I attain the uncontaminated state, I will not break this cross legged posture.

original: ci'i 'di dag la skyes nas yongs su nyams pa yod dam ma zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci'i 'di dag la skyes nas yongs su nyams pa yod dam ma zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Why do they retrogress from these?

original: lung bar ma 'char byed kyi mdo bdun pa'i mtha'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i dang por @69a * //
analyzed: lung bar ma 'char byed kyi mdo bdun pa'i mtha'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa'i dang por @69a * //
translated: The first verse of the summary at the end of the seven intermediate scriptures of the Abhidharma states:

original: 'di ltar 'don te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'don te /
translated: It is recited as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ni dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ni dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin la /
translated: Venerable ones, this is a fully ordained monk who is perfect in ethics, perfect in samadhi and perfect in wisdom.

original: de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: “There is a state where one repeatedly enters and emerges from the meditative absorption that stops conception and feeling.”

original: de mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa yang thob par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa yang thob par mi byed cing /
translated: “They do not attain the first direct realization of the truths in this very life,

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang ma yin la lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te /
translated: nor at the time of death, but when their bodies disintegrate, they pass beyond the gods who consume material food

original: yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and are reborn in a divine body that is produced by the mind.

original: der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: der skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: “Having been reborn there, they repeatedly enter and emerge from the meditative absorption that stops conception and feeling. They know that ‘There is a state where one repeatedly enters and emerges from the meditative absorption that stops conception and feeling.’

original: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang na 'dug par gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang na 'dug par gyur te /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayi was sitting in that very gathering.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Venerable Udāyin said to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: dge slong gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: dge slong gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: “Bhikṣu, it is impossible and there is no chance that🔽one who has been born in any of the divine bodies created by the mind would again and again enter and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling. This is impossible.

original: yid las byung ba lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba 'di ni gnas med cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'di ni gnas med
analyzed: yid las byung ba lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba 'di ni gnas med cing yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'di ni gnas med
translated: This is the correct understanding.”

original: do // de ltar lan gnyis lan gsum du smra'o //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di lan gsum gyi bar du phyir zlog par byed khro bar byed cing tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyang bdag gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar
analyzed: do // de ltar lan gnyis lan gsum du smra'o // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di lan gsum gyi bar du phyir zlog par byed khro bar byed cing tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyang bdag gis bshad pa la rjes su yi rang bar
translated: In this way, he spoke twice and three times.🔽Then the Venerable Śāriputra thought, “This bhikṣu has three times refuted what I have said and has become angry.

original: mi byed pas na /
analyzed: mi byed pas na /
translated: Even my fellow practitioners in the holy life do not rejoice in what I have said.

original: bdag bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'gro bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: bdag bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'gro bar bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: I will go to where the Blessed One is.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong zhes bos nas tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus dge slong zhes bos nas tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: Sitting to one side, the venerable Śāriputra addressed the monks, saying, “Venerable ones, here a monk is perfect in morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: perfect in concentration,

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs @69b pa yang yin la /
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs @69b pa yang yin la /
translated: and perfect in wisdom.

original: de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And he knows as it really is: ‘There is a state of composure that is a cessation, a peaceful state, an excellent state, which is attained by a monk who, in this very life, has attained the peak of wisdom.’

original: yang dag ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang dag ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He knows it as it really is.”

original: de nas de'i tshe de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor de'i nang na 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed 'khor de'i nang na 'dug par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayi was in the assembly.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Udayi said to the venerable Sariputra:

original: dge slong gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba 'di ni gnas med cing yang dag pa
analyzed: dge slong gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skyes nas yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba 'di ni gnas med cing yang dag pa
translated: “It is impossible, O Venerable Sariputra, that a bhikṣu, having been reborn in any of the immaterial realms, should repeatedly enter into and emerge from the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.🔽This is impossible.

original: ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'di ni gnas med do zhes de ltar lan gnyis lan gsum du smras so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin shes pa 'di ni gnas med do zhes de ltar lan gnyis lan gsum du smras so //
translated: This is impossible.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du ston pa'i mdun du yang bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di phyir zlog par byed khong khro bar byed cing tshangs par mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyang bdag gis bshad pa la /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du ston pa'i mdun du yang bdag gis bshad pa la dge slong 'di phyir zlog par byed khong khro bar byed cing tshangs par mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyang bdag gis bshad pa la /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra thought, “This monk opposes and criticizes my teaching even in the presence of the Teacher, and the fellow practitioners of pure conduct do not rejoice in my teaching.

original: rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas bdag cang mi smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pas bdag cang mi smra bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Therefore, I will remain silent.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu cang mi smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu cang mi smra bar gyur to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra remained silent.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Udayin:

original: 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang yin par shes /
analyzed: 'char byed khyod kyis yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba gang yin par shes /
translated: “Udayin, do you know which of the divine bodies produced from the mind is which?”

original: btsun pa ji srid du gzugs can ma yin pa lha 'du shes can de dag ma lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa ji srid du gzugs can ma yin pa lha 'du shes can de dag ma lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, are they not the gods who have perception but are not physical?”🔽“

original: skyes bu rmongs pa long ba khyod mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam zhes de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la mngon sum du spyos nas tshe dang
analyzed: skyes bu rmongs pa long ba khyod mig dang ldan pa dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang lhan cig chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba'i gtam bya bar sems sam zhes de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed la mngon sum du spyos nas tshe dang
translated: You blind fool, do you think that you can discuss the Abhidharma and the Vinaya with the monk Shariputra, who has eyes?

original: ldan pa kun dga' bo la bos te /
analyzed: ldan pa kun dga' bo la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One directly reprimanded the Venerable Udayin and addressed the Venerable Ananda:

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyang dge slong gnas brtan rnams la rnam par gtses pa btang snyoms su byed dam /🔽skyes bu chen po dge slong gnas brtan gtses pa la snying rje yang ma skyes sam zhes de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la mngon sum du spyos nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyang dge slong gnas brtan rnams la rnam par gtses pa btang snyoms su byed dam / skyes bu chen po dge slong gnas brtan gtses pa la snying rje yang ma skyes sam zhes de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'char byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la mngon sum du spyos nas /
translated: Ananda, do you also ignore the harassment of the elder monks?

original: dge slong rnams la bos te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bos te /
translated: Then the Blessed One directly reprimanded the Venerable Udayin and the Venerable Ananda and addressed the monks:

original: 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: Here, a monk is also perfect in morality,

original: ting nge 'dzin @70a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin @70a * //
translated: in concentration,

original: phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa yang yin /
translated: It is also the perfection of wisdom.🔽There is a state in which one repeatedly enters and arises from the meditative absorption that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin la de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab phun sum tshogs pa yang yin la de yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One should know that state correctly, just as it is.

original: de mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang yin la /
analyzed: de mthong ba'i chos kho na la dang po nyid du kun shes pa thob par yang mi byed cing 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe yang yin la /
translated: One does not attain the state of complete understanding in this very life.

original: lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang kham gyi zas za ba'i lha las 'das te yid las byung ba'i lha'i lus gang yang rung ba zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one dies, one passes beyond the gods who consume gross physical food and is reborn in a body that is born of the mind, in one of the god realms.

original: der skyes nas kyang yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang yang dang yang du 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i gnas de yod do zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: Having been reborn there, one should know that state correctly, just as it is, in which one repeatedly enters and arises from the meditative absorption that is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jig gi phyir gdan las bzhengs te gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jig gi phyir gdan las bzhengs te gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
translated: The Bhagavān rose from his seat and entered his dwelling in order to be alone.

original: mdo las mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sūtra says, “There are nine serial absorptions.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting was in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong dag mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dgu po 'di rnams te /🔽'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dgu po 'di rnams te / 'dod pa las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa /
translated: “Monks, there are these nine serial absorptions.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
translated: “One achieves and remains in the first concentration, which is accompanied by investigation and analysis, and is born of seclusion, and is filled with joy and bliss.

original: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first serial absorption.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi nas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: “Having stilled investigation and analysis, one achieves and remains in the second concentration, which has an inner clarity of confidence and is filled with joy and bliss, born of concentration.🔽This is the second serial absorption.🔽“Having given up joy, one remains in equanimity, with mindfulness and introspection, and experiences with one’s body the bliss of which the noble ones say, ‘One remains equanimous, mindful, and blissful.’

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur nas rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
translated: Having one-pointed mind, free from thought and discernment, he achieves and abides in the second concentration, which possesses joy and pleasure born of samādhi.

original: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second meditative absorption.

original: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas te /
analyzed: de dga' ba las 'dod chags dang bral nas btang snyoms su gnas te /
translated: Free from attachment to joy, he abides in equanimity,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde pa lus kyis so sor myong la gang 'phags pa rnams kyis btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dran pa can bde ba dang ldan pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can bde pa lus kyis so sor myong la gang 'phags pa rnams kyis btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa dran pa can bde ba dang ldan pa bsam gtan gsum pa nye bar bsgrubs shing gnas te /
translated: mindful and fully aware, experiencing pleasure with the body. He achieves and abides in the third concentration, which the noble ones describe as: “mindful, equanimous, and happy.”

original: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third meditative absorption.

original: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing @70b yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba sngar nyid du nub cing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing @70b yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba sngar nyid du nub cing bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i btang snyoms yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa nye bar bsgrubs te
translated: He has abandoned pleasure, abandoned pain, and previously abandoned mental well-being and mental anguish, and so abides in the fourth concentration that is neither painful nor pleasant and has complete purity of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: gnas so // 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so // 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth meditative absorption.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: He completely transcends perceptions of form,

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes nub cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes nam mkha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes nub cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so zhes nam mkha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni lnga pa'o //
translated: and so, with the thought, “Space is infinite,” he achieves and abides in the sphere of infinite space. This is the fifth.

original: de nas rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Then, completely transcending the sphere of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni drug pa'o //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni drug pa'o // de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The sixth is the attainment of the station of infinite consciousness, thinking consciousness is infinite.

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni bdun pa'o //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skya mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni bdun pa'o // de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skya mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the attainment of the station of nothing whatsoever, thinking there is nothing whatsoever, having completely transcended the station of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: The eighth is the attainment of the station of neither perception nor non-perception, thinking there is neither perception nor non-perception, having completely transcended the station of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni dgu pa ste //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing nye bar bsgrubs te gnas pa 'di ni dgu pa ste //
translated: The ninth is the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, having completely transcended the station of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu pa'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: This is the ninth meditative absorption of progressive abiding.

original: gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa dang / reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three coming together is contact. Feeling arises from contact.

original: ji ltar re zhig mdzod kyi gnas dang por lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig mdzod kyi gnas dang por lag pa brdabs pa'i dpe'i mdo de dang de las 'don pa bzhin no //
translated: As it says in the first chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, the sūtra on the example of clapping one’s hands.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la brten te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa la brten te /
translated: In dependence on contact that is accompanied by ignorance,

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: feeling that is accompanied by ignorance arises.

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, in the morning, put on his lower and upper robes, took his alms bowl, and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms srung nas zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms srung nas zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas /
translated: After going for alms in Śrāvastī, he ate his meal,

original: gsol zin pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu ste /
analyzed: gsol zin pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu ste /
translated: and after the meal, he put away his alms bowl and robes.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma mthong zhing nye @71a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma mthong zhing nye @71a * //
translated: The saṅgha of monks did not see him and did not know

original: bar gnas pa'i dge slong la ma sbran par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
analyzed: bar gnas pa'i dge slong la ma sbran par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
translated: Without informing the monks who were staying in between, he took up his robes and bowl

original: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal gang na ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal gang na ba der gshegs so //
translated: and went to the west, traveling through the countryside to the Ānanda Grove.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig aanda'i tshal na gnas shing 'gro ba na des bcom ldan 'das gcig pu gnyis su med ba nye bar gnas pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig aanda'i tshal na gnas shing 'gro ba na des bcom ldan 'das gcig pu gnyis su med ba nye bar gnas pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
translated: Another monk was staying in the Ānanda Grove. As he was walking around, he saw the Blessed One, alone, without a companion, taking up his robes and bowl

original: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal du byon te aa mra'i tshal du bzhugs pa mthong ngo /
analyzed: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal du byon te aa mra'i tshal du bzhugs pa mthong ngo /
translated: and going to the west, traveling through the countryside to the Ānanda Grove, where he stayed in the mango grove.🔽When he saw this, he went to the venerable Ānanda

original: mthong nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: mthong nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: and said to him,🔽“Venerable Ānanda, the Blessed One, alone, without a companion, taking up his robes and bowl,

original: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so ;
analyzed: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so ;
translated: went to the west, traveling through the countryside to the Ānanda Grove, where he stayed in the mango grove.”🔽“Venerable friend, the Blessed One is not going to the west.

original: / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes sam 'di ni bdag aanda'i tshal na gnas shing 'gro ba na bcom ldan 'das gcig pu gnyis su med pa nye bar gnas pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
analyzed: / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo khyod kyis shes sam 'di ni bdag aanda'i tshal na gnas shing 'gro ba na bcom ldan 'das gcig pu gnyis su med pa nye bar gnas pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te /
translated: “Do you know, Venerable Ānanda, that I was staying in the Ānanda Grove, and when I went out, I saw the Blessed One alone, without a companion, without anyone attending to him, carrying his Dharma robes and alms bowl,

original: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal du byon te aa mra'i tshal du bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal du byon te aa mra'i tshal du bzhugs pa mthong ngo //
translated: and heading west to go on a journey through the countryside and stay in the Āmra Grove.

original: dge slong gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma mthong zhing nye bar gnas pa'i dge slong la ma sbran par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te gshegs pa de'i tshe na dge slong su yang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs nas mi 'brang
analyzed: dge slong gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma mthong zhing nye bar gnas pa'i dge slong la ma sbran par chos gos dang lhung bzed bsnams te gshegs pa de'i tshe na dge slong su yang bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs nas mi 'brang
translated: “Monks, whenever the Blessed One goes out without the saṅgha of monks seeing him and without informing the monks who are attending to him, carrying his Dharma robes and alms bowl, no monk follows in the Blessed One’s footsteps.

original: ba ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ba ste / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das thugs las chung ngur bzhugs shing thugs las bskyungs te bzhugs pas so //
analyzed: de'i dus na bcom ldan 'das thugs las chung ngur bzhugs shing thugs las bskyungs te bzhugs pas so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was staying in a place of little activity, staying in a place of rest.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang phyogs kyi lnga len du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang phyogs kyi lnga len du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, wandering in stages in the northern country,

original: shing s'a la bzang po gzhan zhig gi drung du brten te bzhugs so //
analyzed: shing s'a la bzang po gzhan zhig gi drung du brten te bzhugs so //
translated: came to the land of Pañcāla and stayed near another fine Sāla tree.

original: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rab tu mang po tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Then many monks approached the venerable Ānanda,

original: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nye bar song nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and after approaching, they said this to the venerable Ānanda:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs pa thos sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs pa thos sam /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, have you heard where the Blessed One is staying?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das nub phyogs su ljongs rgyu zhing zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: “Venerable ones, I have heard that the Blessed One, wandering in stages in the western country,

original: snga ma bzhin du shing s'a la bzang po'i drung na bzhugs so zhes thos so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du shing s'a la bzang po'i drung na bzhugs so zhes thos so //
translated: has come to the land of Pañcāla and is staying near another fine Sāla tree.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo mi shes sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo mi shes sam /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, don’t you know?

original: bdag cag yun ring por bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'dod pas skom pas gdungs te bdag cag bcom ldan 'das mthong zhing blta bar 'dod pas tshe @71b dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gal te khyod la mi gnon na bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar
analyzed: bdag cag yun ring por bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'dod pas skom pas gdungs te bdag cag bcom ldan 'das mthong zhing blta bar 'dod pas tshe @71b dang ldan pa kun dga' bo gal te khyod la mi gnon na bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar
translated: “We have been thirsting for a long time to see the Blessed One. If it is not troublesome for you, Venerable Ānanda, we would like to see the Blessed One and behold him.

original: 'gro bas thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: 'gro bas thugs brtse bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Please take pity on us and go to the Blessed One.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
translated: Venerable Ānanda assented to the many monks by remaining silent.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang dge slong rab tu mang po de dag de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das pa dang / snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms kyi phyir mnyan yod du zhugs te /🔽bsod snyoms spyad nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang dge slong rab tu mang po de dag de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das pa dang / snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms kyi phyir mnyan yod du zhugs te / bsod snyoms spyad nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: Then, after the night had passed, Venerable Ānanda and the many monks put on their lower and upper robes, took their alms bowls, and entered Śrāvastī for alms.🔽After they had gone for alms and eaten their fill,

original: zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu ste /
analyzed: zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu ste /
translated: they put away their alms bowls,

original: ji ltar yongs su spyod pa'i mal cha dag bsdus te chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su spyod pa'i mal cha dag bsdus te chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
translated: He then gathered up the bedding where he had been staying, took up his robes and bowl,

original: ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal gang na ba der song ngo //
analyzed: ljongs rgyu zhing aanda'i tshal gang na ba der song ngo //
translated: and set out wandering toward the Ānanda Grove.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang dge slong rab tu mang po de dag byang phyogs kyi lnga len du ljongs rgyu zhing pa ta la'i tshal gang na ba der phyin te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang dge slong rab tu mang po de dag byang phyogs kyi lnga len du ljongs rgyu zhing pa ta la'i tshal gang na ba der phyin te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda and the many monks wandered through the northern country and arrived at the Pāṭalī Grove.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang ; dge slong rab tu mang po de dag chos gos dang lhung bzed phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rkang pa bkrus nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo dang ; dge slong rab tu mang po de dag chos gos dang lhung bzed phyogs gcig tu bzhag nas rkang pa bkrus nas /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda and the many monks put their robes and bowls aside, washed their feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste /
translated: and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas /
analyzed: nye bar song nas /
translated: Having approached him,
