original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyis gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par bkod /🔽yang dag par btsud /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas dge slong rab tu mang po de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyis gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par bkod / yang dag par btsud /
translated: Seated to one side, the Blessed One taught the Dharma to the many monks, exhorting, encouraging, and delighting them.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byas so //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byas so //
translated: He instructed, inspired, and delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig 'khor de'i nang na tshogs shing 'dus pa de 'di lta bu'i sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa skyes te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong gzhan zhig 'khor de'i nang na tshogs shing 'dus pa de 'di lta bu'i sems la sems kyi rjes su rtog pa skyes te /
translated: Then another monk in the assembly had this thought:

original: ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong ba'i rjes la zag pa thams cad zad par 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong ba'i rjes la zag pa thams cad zad par 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: “How can I understand and see so that all defilements are exhausted?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de'i sems thugs kyi mkhyen nas dge slong de dag la bos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de'i sems thugs kyi mkhyen nas dge slong de dag la bos te /
translated: The Blessed One, knowing the mind of that monk, addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag gal te 'khor 'dir 'dus shing 'tshogs te 'dug pa'i rigs kyi bu 'ba' zhig la 'di lta bu'i sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i gnas yod cing go skabs yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te 'khor 'dir 'dus shing 'tshogs te 'dug pa'i rigs kyi bu 'ba' zhig la 'di lta bu'i sems la sems kyi rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i gnas yod cing go skabs yod de /

translated: The four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.

original: de'i yang dag par mthong ba na de ni 'dus byas te /
analyzed: de'i yang dag par mthong ba na de ni 'dus byas te /
translated: When he sees it in this way, it is conditioned.

analyzed: dge slong 'du byed gang gi rgyu can dang gang las yang dag par byung ba dang / gang las skyes pa dang / gang las rab tu byung zhe na /

translated: “Monks, feeling arises from the contact of ignorance, craving arises in dependence on action, and the formations arise from craving.

original: dge slong dag sred pa gang gi rgyu can dang / gang las yang dag par byung ba dang / gang las skye ba dang / gang las rab tu byung zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag sred pa gang gi rgyu can dang / gang las yang dag par byung ba dang / gang las skye ba dang / gang las rab tu byung zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the cause of craving? What is its source? What gives rise to it? What is its origin?

original: dge slong dag sred pa ni tshor ba'i rgyu can /
analyzed: dge slong dag sred pa ni tshor ba'i rgyu can /
translated: “Monks, feeling is the cause of craving.

analyzed: tshor ba las yang dag par byung ba dang / tshor ba las skyes pa dang / tshor ba las rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: Craving arises from feeling, is born from feeling, originates from feeling, and is produced from feeling.

analyzed: dge slong dag tshor ba gang gi rgyu dang / gang las yang dag par byung ba / gang las skyes pa /

analyzed: gang las yang dag par byung zhe na /

translated: “Monks, contact is the cause of feeling.

original: reg pa las skyes pa reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa las skyes pa reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Feeling arises from contact, is born from contact, originates from contact, and is produced from contact.

original: dge slong dag reg pa gang gi rgyu can dang / gang las yang dag par byung @72b ba dang / gang las skyes pa dang / gang las yang dag par byung zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag reg pa gang gi rgyu can dang / gang las yang dag par byung @72b ba dang / gang las skyes pa dang / gang las yang dag par byung zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the cause of contact? What is its source? What is its origin? What gives rise to it?

original: dge slong dag reg pa ni skye mched drug gi rgyu can dang / skye mched drug las yang dag par byung ba /🔽skye mched drug las skyes pa /🔽skye mched drug las rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag reg pa ni skye mched drug gi rgyu can dang / skye mched drug las yang dag par byung ba / skye mched drug las skyes pa / skye mched drug las rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: Monks, contact has the six sense fields as its cause, the six sense fields as its source, the six sense fields as its origin, and the six sense fields as that which gives rise to it.

original: dge slong dag de las skye mched drug dang / mid dang gzugs ni mi rtag pa /🔽'dus byas pa sems las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de las skye mched drug dang / mid dang gzugs ni mi rtag pa / 'dus byas pa sems las byung ba ste /

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //

original: reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / 'dus byas kyang mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas pa dang / sems las byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //

translated: Monks, formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, and subject to destruction, vanishing, fading away, and cessation.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rtag pa'am zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa rtag pa'am zhes bya ba nas /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are permanent,

original: snga ma bzhin du rtog gam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rtog gam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: or that they are impermanent, or that they are both, or that they are neither.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na dge slong rab tu mang po de dag nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na dge slong rab tu mang po de dag nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was being taught, the minds of many monks were liberated from the contaminants without further appropriation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe dang drod dang rnam shes 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa las rnam par bshad pa rgyas par dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe dang drod dang rnam shes 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa las rnam par bshad pa rgyas par dge slong ma chos sbyin gyi mdo las blta bar bya'o //
translated: And in the sutra, the Blessed One said, “Monks, the body is obtained through heat and consciousness,” and so on. The extensive explanation should be understood from the Bhiksuni Dharmadinna Sutra.

original: mdo las lus thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las lus thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutra says, “There are four types of obtaining a body.”

original: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na'o //
translated: The setting is in Shravasti.

original: lus thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: “There are four types of obtaining a body. What are the four?

original: lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyis gzhan gyis gsod pa ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyis gzhan gyis gsod pa ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: There is a type of obtaining a body where one dies by oneself, not by being killed by another.

original: lus thob pa gang zhig gzhan gyis gsod kyi bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa yang yod /🔽lus thob pa gang zhig rang nyid 'chi zhing gzhan gyis kyang gsod pa yang yod /
analyzed: lus thob pa gang zhig gzhan gyis gsod kyi bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa yang yod / lus thob pa gang zhig rang nyid 'chi zhing gzhan gyis kyang gsod pa yang yod /
translated: There are some who die by their own hand, but not by the hand of another.🔽There are some who die by the hand of another, but not by their own hand.🔽There are some who die by their own hand and by the hand of another.

original: las thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang mi gsod pa yang yod /
analyzed: las thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang mi gsod pa yang yod /
translated: There are some who die neither by their own hand nor by the hand of another.

original: de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang na 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i dus na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dus pa de'i nang na 'dug par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Śāriputra was present in the assembly.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu stan las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig @74a * //🔽tu gzar te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar nas phyag byas te /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig @74a * // tu gzar te / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar nas phyag byas te /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽and with his right knee touching the ground,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: he bowed to the Blessed One with his palms together and said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa de la lus thob pa gang zhis bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: btsun pa de la lus thob pa gang zhis bdag nyid 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Respected Blessed One, there are some who die by their own hand,

original: gzhan gyis gsod pa ma yin pa ni bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyis sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so //🔽lus thob pa gang zhig gzhan gyis gsod kyi /🔽bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsod pa ma yin pa ni bdag nyid kyi rkyen gyis sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so // lus thob pa gang zhig gzhan gyis gsod kyi / bdag nyid 'chi ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: Those who die without being killed are those sentient beings who die from that state due to their own conditions.🔽Those who die and are killed by others are those sentient beings who die from that state due to the conditions of others.

original: lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang 'chi zhing gzhan gyis kyang gsod pa ni bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang 'chi zhing gzhan gyis kyang gsod pa ni bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: Those who die and are killed by themselves are those sentient beings who die from that state due to their own and others' conditions.

original: btsun pa de la lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang mi gsod pa'i sems can de dag gang du blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa de la lus thob pa gang zhig bdag nyid kyang mi 'chi la gzhan gyis kyang mi gsod pa'i sems can de dag gang du blta bar bgyi /
translated: Venerable One, where should one look for those sentient beings who die neither by themselves nor are killed by others?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: Śāriputra replied, Śāriputra, they are the beings who go to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: btsun pa ci sems can de dag thams cad bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ram 'on te kha cig / sh'a ri'i bu sems can de dag las kha cig ni gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: btsun pa ci sems can de dag thams cad bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ram 'on te kha cig / sh'a ri'i bu sems can de dag las kha cig ni gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la /
translated: Śāriputra, some of those beings will die and pass on from that place,

original: de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: and some of them will attain complete nirvāṇa in that way.”

original: btsun pa ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis sems can de dag las kha cig ni bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: btsun pa ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis sems can de dag las kha cig ni bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur la /
translated: “Noble one, what is the cause and what is the condition that some of those beings will die and pass on from that place,

original: de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur /
translated: and some of them will attain complete nirvāṇa in that way?”

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di na kha cig rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di na kha cig rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “Śāriputra, some of them will transcend the entire sense field of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas shing /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas shing /
translated: and they will attain and dwell in the sense field of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang zhing nges pa dang bcas pa dang zhen pa dang lhag par zhen cing gnas te /
analyzed: de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang zhing nges pa dang bcas pa dang zhen pa dang lhag par zhen cing gnas te /
translated: They experience the absorption of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, and they are certain, attached, and fixated on it.

original: de bla ma dang nges par 'byung ba dang / 'di nyid bla na med pa dang nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de bla ma dang nges par 'byung ba dang / 'di nyid bla na med pa dang nges par 'byung ba yin no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: They know it to be superior and to be the highest emergence.

original: lus zhig pa'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhig pa'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When their bodies disintegrate, they are reborn in a state equal to the gods of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: der ji srid du tshe'i tshad yod @74b par gnas ta /
analyzed: der ji srid du tshe'i tshad yod @74b par gnas ta /
translated: They remain there for as long as they have life.

original: ji srid du tshe gnas pa'i 'du byed de dag yongs su zad pa dad gnas de nas yongs su 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du tshe gnas pa'i 'du byed de dag yongs su zad pa dad gnas de nas yongs su 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the formative predispositions that constitute their life-span are exhausted, they pass away from that state.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni kha cig rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ni kha cig rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: Śāriputra, some transcend the entire sphere of the base of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas shing de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro mi myang zhing nges par mi byed la ma zhen cing lhag par ma zhen par gnas la bla ma
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched nye bar bsgrubs te gnas shing de 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro mi myang zhing nges par mi byed la ma zhen cing lhag par ma zhen par gnas la bla ma
translated: They attain and abide in the base of neither perception nor non-perception, but they do not relish the meditative absorption of the base of neither perception nor non-perception, they do not make it definite, they do not cling to it, and they do not over-cling to it. They abide with a superior

original: dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te ;
analyzed: dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te ;
translated: attitude, thinking, ‘This is not the goal,’ ‘This is not the holy life,’ ‘This is not the perfect awakening of a buddha,’ ‘This is not the complete ending of suffering.’

original: lus zhig pa'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zhig pa'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When their bodies give out, they are reborn in a state equal to the gods of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de der tshe'i tshad ji srid par gnas te /
analyzed: de der tshe'i tshad ji srid par gnas te /
translated: They remain there for as long as they live.

original: ji srid du tshe gnas pa'i 'du shes de dag zad pa dang de bzhin du de yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: ji srid du tshe gnas pa'i 'du shes de dag zad pa dang de bzhin du de yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro//
translated: When the perception of remaining alive is exhausted, they will pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di'i rgyu dang 'di'i rkyen gyis sems can de dag las kha cig ni bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di'i rgyu dang 'di'i rkyen gyis sems can de dag las kha cig ni bdag nyid gnas de nas 'chi bar 'gyur la /
translated: Śāriputra, by this cause and this condition, some of those sentient beings die from that place.

original: sems can de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to /
analyzed: sems can de dag las kha cig ni 'di ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to /
translated: Some of those sentient beings will pass into complete nirvāṇa in this way.”

original: rtsed mos myos pa pa rnams dang yid rab tu 'khrug pa la rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsed mos myos pa pa rnams dang yid rab tu 'khrug pa la rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are intoxicated by play and those whose minds are disturbed.

original: dge slong dag 'dod pa'i khams na lha rtsed mos myos pa pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod pa'i khams na lha rtsed mos myos pa pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: Bhikṣus, in the desire realm there are gods called intoxicated by play.

original: de gang gi dus na rtsed mo'i dga' ba dang ldan zhing gnas pa de dag rtsed mo'i dga' ba mang po dang ldan zhing gnas pas lus ngal ba dang dran pa nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gang gi dus na rtsed mo'i dga' ba dang ldan zhing gnas pa de dag rtsed mo'i dga' ba mang po dang ldan zhing gnas pas lus ngal ba dang dran pa nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: When they are engaged in the joys of play, they are engaged in many joys of play. Their bodies become tired and their mindfulness declines.

original: dran pa yang dag par nyams pas sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag par nyams pas sems can de dag gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because their mindfulness has declined, those sentient beings die and transmigrate from that place.

original: dge slong dag 'dod pa'i khams na yid rab tu 'khrug pa pa zhes bya ba'i lha yod de /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'dod pa'i khams na yid rab tu 'khrug pa pa zhes bya ba'i lha yod de /
translated: Monks, there are gods in the desire realm called agitated mind.

original: de dag gang gi tshe mig gis mig tshugs su mang du blta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gang gi tshe mig gis mig tshugs su mang du blta bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they look at each other with their eyes,

original: de dag mig gis mig tshugs su mang du lta ba na yid rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag mig gis mig tshugs su mang du lta ba na yid rab tu 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: their minds become agitated.🔽Because their minds are agitated, they die and transmigrate from that realm.

original: de dag yid rab tu 'khrugs pas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhes mdzod kyi gnas gsum par tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdor tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad par 'gyur ro //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod @75a * //
analyzed: de dag yid rab tu 'khrugs pas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhes mdzod kyi gnas gsum par tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdor tshangs pa'i dra ba las bshad par 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang yin par brjod @75a * //
translated: This is explained in the Brahmajala Sūtra in the Basket of Moral Discipline.

original: par bya zhes bya la /
analyzed: par bya zhes bya la /
translated: It should be said that this is also the case for buddhas.

original: ji skad du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas srog gi 'du byed btang ngo zhes dbang po'i skabs su srog gi rnam smin zhes pa der bris pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas srog gi 'du byed btang ngo zhes dbang po'i skabs su srog gi rnam smin zhes pa der bris pa bzhin no //
translated: As it says in the Parinirvāṇa Sūtra, “The Bhagavān blessed the compositional factors of life and relinquished the compositional factors of life.”

original: sku tshe'i sum cha btang nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: sku tshe'i sum cha btang nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas to pass into complete nirvāṇa after having given up three quarters of their life.

original: ston pa ni dug dang mtshon dang mtshon cha dang sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang gnod pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs dang / lha dang lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyis kyang bgrang bar mi nus pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: ston pa ni dug dang mtshon dang mtshon cha dang sngags dang 'khrul 'khor dang gnod pa'i thabs rnam pa sna tshogs dang / lha dang lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyis kyang bgrang bar mi nus pa 'di ni chos nyid yin no //
translated: It is the nature of things that the Teacher cannot be killed by poison, weapons, or various kinds of harmful spells and magical devices, even by the lords of the gods and titans.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang zhes bya ba la rnam par 'byed pa mdo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i phung po las dang po bslab pa'i sdom rab tu dga' ba'i ched du brjod pa rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du dge slong dag chos 'di la
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang zhes bya ba la rnam par 'byed pa mdo'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa'i phung po las dang po bslab pa'i sdom rab tu dga' ba'i ched du brjod pa rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du dge slong dag chos 'di la
translated: The path of seeing means that in the Sutra Collection's chapter on discernment, the first aggregate of the three verses of the compendium of training, in the discernment of the expression of complete joy, it is said: Monks, this Dharma is profound, difficult to see, difficult to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the realm of logic, comprehensible only to the wise.

original: shes rab chung ngus bsgom par bzod pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab chung ngus bsgom par bzod pa ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those with little wisdom who are patient in meditation are called followers of faith.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing so so'i skye bo'i sa las rnam par 'das la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar ma dor mi 'chi'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing so so'i skye bo'i sa las rnam par 'das la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar ma dor mi 'chi'o //
translated: They ascend to the stage of right and certain discrimination, transcend the stage of ordinary beings, and do not die in the interim before attaining the fruit of stream-entry.

original: dge slong dag chos 'di la shes rab chung ngus bsgom par bzod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos 'di la shes rab chung ngus bsgom par bzod pa ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, those who can cultivate this Dharma with lesser wisdom are called Dharma-followers.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sa non cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They ascend to the stage of right and certain discrimination, and so on, up to

original: snga ma bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar ma dor mi 'chi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma thob par bar ma dor mi 'chi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: they do not die in the interim before attaining the fruit of stream-entry.

original: mdo 'di yang mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
analyzed: mdo 'di yang mdzod kyi gnas dang por /
translated: This sūtra is written in the first chapter of the Abhidharma-kośa,

original: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
analyzed: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
translated: as stated in the line Apart from the four aggregates of formations...🔽and so on, up to The Blessed One explained this in the Ṣat-pāramitā-sūtra.

original: zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo drug pa las ji skad du bshad pa der bris pa bzhin no byams pa la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo drug pa las ji skad du bshad pa der bris pa bzhin no byams pa la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Enters into the concentration of loving-kindness means

original: ji ltar re zhig bad sa la'i rgyal po 'char byed kyi btsun mo dpe med ma dang sngo bsangs ma mi mthun par sngo bsangs ma la rab tu khros so //
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig bad sa la'i rgyal po 'char byed kyi btsun mo dpe med ma dang sngo bsangs ma mi mthun par sngo bsangs ma la rab tu khros so //
translated: For example, the king of Vatsa, Udayana, was not on good terms with his two queens, Anupama and Śyāmāvatī. He was very angry with Śyāmāvatī.

original: 'jig rten na mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang bar ma dag yod pas kha cig khyod la lha khros so zhes sngo bsangs ma la smras so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang bar ma dag yod pas kha cig khyod la lha khros so zhes sngo bsangs ma la smras so //
translated: In the world, there are friends, enemies and neutrals. Some said to Śyāmāvatī, “The king is angry with you.”

original: sngo bsangs mas rang gi 'khor rnams la bos te /
analyzed: sngo bsangs mas rang gi 'khor rnams la bos te /
translated: Śyāmāvatī called her retinue together and said,

original: sring mo dag bdag cag thams cad byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes de thams cad byams pa la @75b snyoms par zhugs pa dang / bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed kyis gzhu bkang nas mda' 'phangs so //
analyzed: sring mo dag bdag cag thams cad byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes de thams cad byams pa la @75b snyoms par zhugs pa dang / bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed kyis gzhu bkang nas mda' 'phangs so //
translated: “Sisters, we should all cultivate the concentration of loving kindness.” They all entered into the meditative absorption of loving kindness, and King Udayana of Vatsa drew his bow and shot an arrow.

original: mda' de lam phyed du phyin pa dang / sa la lhung bar gyur to //
analyzed: mda' de lam phyed du phyin pa dang / sa la lhung bar gyur to //
translated: The arrow went halfway and fell to the ground.

original: yang gnyis pa bkang ba dang sngo bsangs mas smras pa /
analyzed: yang gnyis pa bkang ba dang sngo bsangs mas smras pa /
translated: Again he drew his bow and Śyāmāvatī said,

original: lha ma 'phen mdzod rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du phog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma 'phen mdzod rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du phog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The god will not strike the queen in any way.

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said:

original: ci khyod lha mo'am /🔽klu mo'am / gnod sbyin mo'am /🔽dri za mo'am /
analyzed: ci khyod lha mo'am / klu mo'am / gnod sbyin mo'am / dri za mo'am /
translated: Are you a goddess,🔽a nāgī, a yakṣiṇī,🔽a gandharvī,

original: mi'am ci mo'am /
analyzed: mi'am ci mo'am /
translated: a kinnarī,

original: lto 'phye chen po zhig yin nam /🔽lha bdag lha mo yang ma yin /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po zhig yin nam / lha bdag lha mo yang ma yin /
translated: or a mahoragī?🔽The queen replied:

original: klu mo dang / gnod sbyin mo dang / dri za mo dang / mi 'am ci mo dang ; lto 'phye chen mo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: klu mo dang / gnod sbyin mo dang / dri za mo dang / mi 'am ci mo dang ; lto 'phye chen mo ma yin gyi /
translated: I am not a goddess, nor am I a nāgī, yakṣiṇī, gandharvī, kinnarī, or mahoragī.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos phyir mi 'ong ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'dul ba las 'don pa lta bu'o 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos phyir mi 'ong ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'dul ba las 'don pa lta bu'o 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: However, I am a nonreturner śrāvaka of the Bhagavat.

original: dbyangs dang bcas pas bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bdud bsdigs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dbyangs dang bcas pas bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa bdud bsdigs pa'i mdo las /
translated: The two verses that summarize the summary with its melody are from the Sūtra of the Subjugation of Māra.

original: gnas brtan mood dgal gyi bu chen pos bdud las brtsams te ji skad du /
analyzed: gnas brtan mood dgal gyi bu chen pos bdud las brtsams te ji skad du /
translated: The elder Mahāmaudgalyāyana spoke to Māra as follows:

original: sdig can yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi dge slong 'tsho byed dang mkhas pa zhes bya ba mchog zung gcig zung mchog dang zung bzang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: sdig can yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi dge slong 'tsho byed dang mkhas pa zhes bya ba mchog zung gcig zung mchog dang zung bzang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: “Evil one, in the case of the Perfectly Awakened One Vipaśyin, the two chief disciples named Jīvaka and Pañcaśika were the best pair, the supreme pair, the excellent pair.

original: gcig ni rdzu 'phrul can gyi mchog / gnyis pa ni shes rab can gyi mchog go //
analyzed: gcig ni rdzu 'phrul can gyi mchog / gnyis pa ni shes rab can gyi mchog go //
translated: One was the foremost in miraculous abilities, the other was the foremost in wisdom.

original: sdig can rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed la 'tsho byed 'tsho byed ces ming gang gi phyir byas she na /
analyzed: sdig can rgyu gang dang rkyen gang gis tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed la 'tsho byed 'tsho byed ces ming gang gi phyir byas she na /
translated: Evil one, for what reason, for what cause was the venerable Jīvaka called Jīvaka?

original: sdig can tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed grong ngam grong khyer gang du brten cing nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: sdig can tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed grong ngam grong khyer gang du brten cing nye bar gnas te /
translated: Evil one, the venerable Jīvaka, whatever village or town he relied on and stayed near,

original: snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs nas grong dang grong khyer gang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir lus shin tu bsdams pa dang / dbang po shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa nye bar yang dag par gzhag bzhin du zhugs te /
analyzed: snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs nas grong dang grong khyer gang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir lus shin tu bsdams pa dang / dbang po shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa nye bar yang dag par gzhag bzhin du zhugs te /
translated: in the morning, having put on his Dharma robes and taken his alms bowl, for the sake of alms, he entered that village or town with his body well restrained, his senses well restrained, and his mindfulness well established.

original: de grong ngam grong khyer gang du bsod snyoms spyad nas /🔽zas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: de grong ngam grong khyer gang du bsod snyoms spyad nas / zas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: In whatever village or town he has gone for alms,🔽after he has eaten his meal,

original: zas zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu nas /
analyzed: zas zos pa'i 'og tu lhung bzed gyu nas /
translated: he washes his bowl and robes,

original: dgon pa'i gnas su myur ba myur bar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go //🔽de ba lang rdzi dang / phyugs rdzi dang / rtsva thu ba dang / shing thu ba dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam @76a * //
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas su myur ba myur bar 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug go // de ba lang rdzi dang / phyugs rdzi dang / rtsva thu ba dang / shing thu ba dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam @76a * //
translated: and he quickly enters into the absorption of cessation in the forest.

original: na gnas pa'i mi dag gis mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du 'phags pa 'di ni 'dug bzhin du dus las 'das so //🔽gang bdag cag gis rtsva skam po dang / shing skam po dang / ba lang gi lci bskam po bsdus te sbar bar bya ba sbar nas bsreg par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: na gnas pa'i mi dag gis mthong nas de dag 'di snyam du 'phags pa 'di ni 'dug bzhin du dus las 'das so // gang bdag cag gis rtsva skam po dang / shing skam po dang / ba lang gi lci bskam po bsdus te sbar bar bya ba sbar nas bsreg par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Cowherds, shepherds, and travelers see him, and they think, “This holy man has died.”🔽“Let us collect dry sticks, dry cow dung, and dry timber, and light a funeral pyre for him.”🔽They collect dry sticks, dry cow dung, and dry timber, and light a funeral pyre for him.

original: de dag rtsa skam po dang shing skam po dang ba lang gi lci ba skam po bsdus te sbar bar bya ba spar nas me 'bar ba dang song ngo //
analyzed: de dag rtsa skam po dang shing skam po dang ba lang gi lci ba skam po bsdus te sbar bar bya ba spar nas me 'bar ba dang song ngo //
translated: When the fire has burned out, they go away.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed nyin zhag de la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed nyin zhag de la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs te /
translated: Then, the venerable Jīvaka, having arisen from that meditative absorption,

original: chos gos sprugs te snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
analyzed: chos gos sprugs te snga dro chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te /
translated: having shaken out his robes, in the morning, having taken his robes and bowl,🔽having entered the town or city for alms, with his body well restrained, his senses well restrained, his mindfulness well established,

original: grong ngam grong khyer du bsod snyoms kyi phyir lus shin tu bsdams pa dang / dbang po shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa yang dag par nye bar bzhag nas zhugs pa dang / ba lang rdzi dang / phyugs rdzi dang / rtsva thu ba dang /
analyzed: grong ngam grong khyer du bsod snyoms kyi phyir lus shin tu bsdams pa dang / dbang po shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pa yang dag par nye bar bzhag nas zhugs pa dang / ba lang rdzi dang / phyugs rdzi dang / rtsva thu ba dang /
translated: the cowherds, shepherds, grass collectors,

original: shing thu ba dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam na gnas pa'i mi de dag gis mthong nas 'di snyam du bdag cag gis 'phags pa 'di 'dug bzhin du dus las 'das par mthong nas rtsva skam po dang / shing skam po dang /
analyzed: shing thu ba dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang / lam na gnas pa'i mi de dag gis mthong nas 'di snyam du bdag cag gis 'phags pa 'di 'dug bzhin du dus las 'das par mthong nas rtsva skam po dang / shing skam po dang /
translated: wood collectors, road workers, and people living by the road, having seen him, thought, “We have seen this noble one pass away while sitting. Having collected dry grass, dry wood,

original: ba lang gi lci ba skam po bsdus te /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba skam po bsdus te /
translated: and dry cow dung,

original: sbar bar bya ba sbar nas me sbar te 'ongs nas /
analyzed: sbar bar bya ba sbar nas me sbar te 'ongs nas /
translated: having set it on fire, having made a fire,🔽having come,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'phags pa 'di da rung yang 'tsho'am snyam mo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'phags pa 'di da rung yang 'tsho'am snyam mo //
translated: The Buddha said, Venerable Ānanda, is the noble Subhūti still alive?

original: sdig can rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed la 'tsho byed ces ming du byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdig can rgyu 'di dang rkyen 'dis tshe dang ldan pa 'tsho byed la 'tsho byed ces ming du byas so zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of this cause and this condition, the Buddha said, Venerable Jīvaka was given the name Jīvaka.

original: tshe dang ldan pa nye ba 'khor mu la phal su na'i mchod rten gyi rdo'i gos kyi rnyed pa las dge slong ma khab dang mtshon thogs te gnod pa'i sems skyes pa dang / chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa nyid du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye ba 'khor mu la phal su na'i mchod rten gyi rdo'i gos kyi rnyed pa las dge slong ma khab dang mtshon thogs te gnod pa'i sems skyes pa dang / chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa nyid du 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: The Buddha said, Venerable Upāli, because of the acquisition of a robe made of stone at the Mūlasthūna stūpa, a bhikṣuṇī took a needle and thread and gave rise to the thought of harming, and without consecrating the Dharma robe, entered into the concentration of cessation.

original: des chos gos la khab dang mtshon cha brgyab nas shi'o snyam du byas te song ngo //
analyzed: des chos gos la khab dang mtshon cha brgyab nas shi'o snyam du byas te song ngo //
translated: Thinking, She will die having stabbed the Dharma robe with a needle and thread, he left.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin las langs te rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas gtam ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la go bar byas so zhes phran tshogs kyi sgo brgyad pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po las de ltar 'don to //
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin las langs te rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas gtam ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la go bar byas so zhes phran tshogs kyi sgo brgyad pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po las de ltar 'don to //
translated: The first verse of the chapter on the eight classes of phenomena in the Kṣudraka Collection is recited in this way.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong ba'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa sems rtse gcig pa dang sems med pa la /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong ba'i lam la snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa sems rtse gcig pa dang sems med pa la /
translated: Scholars say that the path of seeing and so on is one pointedness of mind and that it is not mindless.

original: rtse gcig sems med pa la de med ces mdzod kyi gnas gsum par 'chi 'pho zhing skye @76b ba bkag ste /
analyzed: rtse gcig sems med pa la de med ces mdzod kyi gnas gsum par 'chi 'pho zhing skye @76b ba bkag ste /
translated: The third chapter of the Abhidharmakośa refutes death and rebirth in one pointedness of mind and in the absence of mind.

original: de lta bu'i spros pa 'chad par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //🔽rgyal po'i drang srong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i spros pa 'chad par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // rgyal po'i drang srong zhes bya ba la /
translated: Such elaborations will be explained later.🔽The chapter on the royal sage.

original: gang yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bu thu bo rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug ste rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po bu thu bo rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug ste rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The eldest son of a universal monarch is made to rule the kingdom and then goes forth.

original: 'di lta ste rgyal po dang yang dag par ldan pa las 'don te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rgyal po dang yang dag par ldan pa las 'don te /
translated: It is like this: it is extracted from the king.

original: lha chen po bcu gnyis pa'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: lha chen po bcu gnyis pa'i mdo las bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: This is stated in the sutra on the twelve great gods, where the Bhagavān said:

original: mi rnams kyi tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu thub pa na rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu thub pa na rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba /
translated: “When the lifespan of humans was eighty thousand years, a king called Mahādeva appeared, a wheel-turning king who was victorious in all four directions,

original: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rgyal po chen po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa byung ste /
analyzed: chos dang ldan zhing chos kyi rgyal po chen po rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa byung ste /
translated: a righteous king who was a great Dharma king, possessing the seven jewels.

original: de'i rin po che 'di lta bu'i gzugs can gyi rin po che sna bdun byung ste /
analyzed: de'i rin po che 'di lta bu'i gzugs can gyi rin po che sna bdun byung ste /
translated: He had these kinds of seven jewels:

original: 'di lta ste 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang bdun no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang / dmag dpon rin po che dang / nor bu rin po che dang bdun no //
translated: the jewel of the wheel, the jewel of the elephant, the jewel of the horse, the jewel of the woman, the jewel of the householder, the jewel of the military commander, and the jewel of the gem.

original: de la bu dpa' ba rtul phod pa yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa stong du tshang ba yang byung bar gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la bu dpa' ba rtul phod pa yan lag mchog gi gzugs dang ldan pa pha rol gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa stong du tshang ba yang byung bar gyur zhing /
translated: He had a thousand sons who were brave, heroic, and had the best of bodies, and who were able to defeat the armies of others.

original: sa chen po 'di rgya mtsho la thug pa ma lus par gnod pa med cing 'tshe ba med pa dang dbyug pa med cing mtshon cha med pas chos kyis rnam par rgyal te gnas so//
analyzed: sa chen po 'di rgya mtsho la thug pa ma lus par gnod pa med cing 'tshe ba med pa dang dbyug pa med cing mtshon cha med pas chos kyis rnam par rgyal te gnas so//
translated: The entire great earth, up to the oceans, was without harm or violence, without sticks or weapons, and was governed righteously.

original: de nas rgyal po lha chen po dus gzhan zhig na 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bu skra dang kha spu bregs pa na /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po lha chen po dus gzhan zhig na 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bu skra dang kha spu bregs pa na /
translated: Then, at another time, King Mahādeva had his head shaved by a barber.

original: 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bu la bos te /
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bu la bos te /
translated: He called out to the barber,

original: skyes bu khyod kyis gang gi tshe nga'i mgo bo las lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung ba mthong ba de'i tshe khyod nga la smros shing //
analyzed: skyes bu khyod kyis gang gi tshe nga'i mgo bo las lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung ba mthong ba de'i tshe khyod nga la smros shing //
translated: “When you see a white hair growing on my head, a messenger of the gods, tell me.”

original: 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen pos smras pa thos nas lha de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen pos smras pa thos nas lha de bzhin no zhes gsol to //
translated: The barber heard what King Mahādeva said and replied, “Your Majesty, it is so.”

original: dus gzhan zhig gi tshe 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen po skra dang kha spu 'dreg pa na /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig gi tshe 'dreg mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen po skra dang kha spu 'dreg pa na /
translated: At another time, when the barber was shaving King Mahādeva’s head and beard,

original: rgyal po lha chen po la lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung bar gyur pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po lha chen po la lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung bar gyur pa mthong ngo //
translated: he saw a divine messenger with white hair appear to King Mahādeva.

original: mthong nas rgyal po lha chen po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mthong nas rgyal po lha chen po la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen this, he said to King Mahādeva,

original: lha'i dbu las lha'i pho nya skra dkar po skyes shing byung bar gyur pa mkhyen par mdzod cig / des smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbu las lha'i pho nya skra dkar po skyes shing byung bar gyur pa mkhyen par mdzod cig / des smras pa /
translated: “Your Majesty, please know that a divine messenger with white hair has appeared on your head.”

original: kye skyes bu khyod kyis skra dkar de gser gyi tsher zungs kyis dal bus dal bus phyung la nga'i lag par byin cig / lha de bzhin no zhes 'dreg @77a * //
analyzed: kye skyes bu khyod kyis skra dkar de gser gyi tsher zungs kyis dal bus dal bus phyung la nga'i lag par byin cig / lha de bzhin no zhes 'dreg @77a * //
translated: He said, “O man, you should slowly and carefully pull out that white hair with a golden tweezer and give it to me.”🔽“Your Majesty, it shall be done,” the barber replied.

original: mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen po'i mgo las skyes pa'i skra dkar gser gyi tsher zungs kyis dal bus dal bus bton te rgyal po lha chen po'i phyag tu phul lo //
analyzed: mkhan gyi skyes bus rgyal po lha chen po'i mgo las skyes pa'i skra dkar gser gyi tsher zungs kyis dal bus dal bus bton te rgyal po lha chen po'i phyag tu phul lo //
translated: The barber slowly and carefully pulled out the white hair that had grown on King Mahādeva’s head with a golden tweezer and offered it to King Mahādeva.

original: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos phyag gnyis kyis skra dkar de bsnams nas /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos phyag gnyis kyis skra dkar de bsnams nas /
translated: Then King Mahādeva took the white hair in both hands,

original: brkyang zhing rab tu brkyang nas /
analyzed: brkyang zhing rab tu brkyang nas /
translated: stretched it out, and stretched it out again,

original: ched du brjod pa /
analyzed: ched du brjod pa /
translated: and uttered this exalted utterance:🔽“On the crown of my head,

original: bdag gi yan lag mchog spyi bor //
analyzed: bdag gi yan lag mchog spyi bor //
translated: the foremost of my limbs,

original: na tshod 'phrog pa dang por skyes //
analyzed: na tshod 'phrog pa dang por skyes //
translated: the first sign of old age has appeared.

original: lha yi pho nya byung gyur pas //
analyzed: lha yi pho nya byung gyur pas //
translated: The messenger of the gods has come.

original: rab tu byung ba'i dus la bab /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i dus la bab /
translated: The time has come for me to go forth.

original: bdag gis mi rnams kyi bde ba ni longs spyod kyis lha'i bde ba bcol ba'i dus la bab po //
analyzed: bdag gis mi rnams kyi bde ba ni longs spyod kyis lha'i bde ba bcol ba'i dus la bab po //
translated: The time has come for me to exchange human happiness for divine happiness.

original: gang bdag gis rgyal bu gzhon nu bu thu bo la rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug nas rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang bdag gis rgyal bu gzhon nu bu thu bo la rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug nas rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: I shall make the eldest prince rule over the kingdom, and I shall practice the pure conduct of a sage, a king.

original: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos rgyal bu gzhon nu thu bo la pho nya btang ste bkug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos rgyal bu gzhon nu thu bo la pho nya btang ste bkug nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then King Mahādeva sent a messenger to summon his eldest prince and said this to him:

original: bu gzhon nu nga'i mgo bo las lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung ba shes par gyis shig / rab tu byung ba'i dus la bab po /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu nga'i mgo bo las lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung ba shes par gyis shig / rab tu byung ba'i dus la bab po /
translated: “ ‘Son, you should know that when a divine messenger with white hair appears on my head, it will be time for you to go forth.

original: bdag gis mi rnams kyi 'dod pa ni yongs su spyad kyi da ni lha'i bde ba btsal ba'i dus la bab pas /
analyzed: bdag gis mi rnams kyi 'dod pa ni yongs su spyad kyi da ni lha'i bde ba btsal ba'i dus la bab pas /
translated: I have enjoyed human pleasures, and now it is time for me to seek divine happiness.

original: bu gzhon nu khyod la sa chen po rgyal mtsho la thug pa 'di khyod la byin gyi /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu khyod la sa chen po rgyal mtsho la thug pa 'di khyod la byin gyi /
translated: Son, I will give you this great land, which extends to the ocean.

original: de dag la khyod kyis chos dang ldan pas yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la khyod kyis chos dang ldan pas yang dag par rjes su bstan par bya ste /
translated: You should teach them the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no //🔽gang kha cig chos ma yin pas spyod cing mi mthun par spyod na yul las skrod cig / bu gzhon nu khyod la yang gang gi tshe lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe khyod kyang rgyal bu gzhon nu thub rgyal srid kyi
analyzed: chos ma yin pas ni ma yin no // gang kha cig chos ma yin pas spyod cing mi mthun par spyod na yul las skrod cig / bu gzhon nu khyod la yang gang gi tshe lha'i pho nya skra dkar skyes shing byung bar gyur pa de'i tshe khyod kyang rgyal bu gzhon nu thub rgyal srid kyi
translated: not non-Dharma.🔽If anyone acts in accordance with non-Dharma and acts unrighteously, banish them from the country.

original: dbang phyug la dbang byed du chug la /
analyzed: dbang phyug la dbang byed du chug la /
translated: Son, when a divine messenger with white hair appears on your head, then you should let Prince Muni­rāja rule the kingdom.

original: rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig / ji ltar yang bu gzhon nu khyod 'di lta bur nges par dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig / ji ltar yang bu gzhon nu khyod 'di lta bur nges par dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang / rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: In this way, young man, you should enter and follow this kind of path of virtue.🔽Do not become a contemptible person, a low-class person.

original: skyes bu tha chad dang / skyes bu tha mar ma gyur cig / bu gzhon nu gang kha cig 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i skyes bu bzang po'i zung la 'jug pa dang / 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i nges pa dang dge ba'i lam la mi 'jug cing rjes su mi 'jug par 'gyur ba de skyes bu tha chad du 'gyur zhing skyes bu tha mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu tha chad dang / skyes bu tha mar ma gyur cig / bu gzhon nu gang kha cig 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i skyes bu bzang po'i zung la 'jug pa dang / 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i nges pa dang dge ba'i lam la mi 'jug cing rjes su mi 'jug par 'gyur ba de skyes bu tha chad du 'gyur zhing skyes bu tha mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Young man, those who do not enter and follow this kind of pair of good men, this kind of certainty, and this kind of path of virtue become contemptible people, low-class people.

original: sa na bu gzhon nu khyod la nga 'di @77b skad du ji ltar khyod 'di lta bu'i ngo bo skyes bu bzang po'i zung la 'jug cing /
analyzed: sa na bu gzhon nu khyod la nga 'di @77b skad du ji ltar khyod 'di lta bu'i ngo bo skyes bu bzang po'i zung la 'jug cing /
translated: Therefore, young man, I say to you: In this way, you should enter and follow this kind of pair of good men,

original: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i nges pa dang / dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo'i nges pa dang / dge ba'i lam la 'jug pa dang rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: this kind of certainty, and this kind of path of virtue.”

original: khyod skyes bu tha chad dang skyes bu tha mar ma gyur cig ces nga smra'o //
analyzed: khyod skyes bu tha chad dang skyes bu tha mar ma gyur cig ces nga smra'o //
translated: I say that you will become a contemptible man, a low-class man.”

original: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos sras gzhon nu thu bo rgya la srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug nas rgyal po'i drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po lha chen pos sras gzhon nu thu bo rgya la srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug nas rgyal po'i drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: Then King Mahādeva, having made his eldest son the lord and master of the kingdom, practiced the pure conduct of a king-seer.

original: kun dga' bo rgyal po lha chen po rgyal bu gzhon nu thu bo rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo rgyal po lha chen po rgyal bu gzhon nu thu bo rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed du bcug ste /
translated: Ānanda, King Mahādeva, having made his eldest son the lord and master of the kingdom,

original: de yang rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba chos dang ldan zhing chos gyi rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du gnas so zhes🔽bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyal po lha chen po zhes bya ba 'khor los sgyur ba mtha' bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba chos dang ldan zhing chos gyi rgyal po rin po che sna bdun dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du gnas so zhes🔽bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: was also called King Mahādeva, a wheel-turning king who had conquered the four borders, a righteous Dharma king who possessed the seven treasures, and so on, up to “he dwelt having conquered without violence.”

original: kun dga' bo de'i yang bu dang bu'i bu dang / tsha bo'i tsha bor rgyal po lha chen po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis me te le'i gzhi 'di nyid du rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyod do //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de'i yang bu dang bu'i bu dang / tsha bo'i tsha bor rgyal po lha chen po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis me te le'i gzhi 'di nyid du rgyal po drang srong gi tshangs par spyod pa spyod do //
translated: Ananda, his sons and grandsons and great-grandsons, eight thousand and four hundred kings named Mahādeva, will practice the pure conduct of sages in this very city of Mathurā.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis kas 'chi ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba btang nas rab tu byung ba yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis kas 'chi ba ma yin pa de bzhin du 'khor los sgyur ba btang nas rab tu byung ba yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as two universal monarchs do not arise without a break, so also two renunciates.

original: rgyal ba'i pho nya zhes bya ba la rgyal ba ni bcom ldan 'das te de'i drung du 'phrin skyel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i pho nya zhes bya ba la rgyal ba ni bcom ldan 'das te de'i drung du 'phrin skyel ba'o //
translated: The messenger of the Victor is one who carries a message to the Victor, the Blessed One.

original: de ni 'phrin skyel ba'i don ma byas par tshe thung ngur 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'phrin skyel ba'i don ma byas par tshe thung ngur 'gyur ba'am /
translated: He would not have a short life due to not carrying out the purpose of the messenger.

original: gnyis ka'i rkyen gyis mi 'chi ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rkyen gyis mi 'chi ste /
translated: He would not die due to the condition of both.

original: aa mra skyong ma'i ne tso bzhin no //
analyzed: aa mra skyong ma'i ne tso bzhin no //
translated: Like the parrot of Āmrapālī.

original: bcom ldan 'das skye ba 'phel ba'i ljongs na rgyu zhing chu bo can du phyin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skye ba 'phel ba'i ljongs na rgyu zhing chu bo can du phyin te /
translated: The Blessed One, traveling through the country of Vṛji, arrived at the bank of the river.

original: chu bo can na bzhugs so zhes aa mra skyong mas thos nas /
analyzed: chu bo can na bzhugs so zhes aa mra skyong mas thos nas /
translated: The mango grove caretaker heard this and said, The Blessed One is staying at the riverbank.

original: de la ne tso bzhin rgyas zhes bya ba mi'i skad smra ba dang go ba zhig yod nas /🔽ne tso bzhin rgyas la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de la ne tso bzhin rgyas zhes bya ba mi'i skad smra ba dang go ba zhig yod nas / ne tso bzhin rgyas la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: She had a parrot named Śrīvatsa who could speak the human language and was understood by humans.

original: bzhin rgyas khyod bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: bzhin rgyas khyod bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: The mango grove caretaker said to the parrot Śrīvatsa, Śrīvatsa, go to where the Blessed One is.

original: nye bar song nas nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag gyis la /🔽gnod pa nyung ngam /🔽nyam nga ba chung ngam /
analyzed: nye bar song nas nga'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag gyis la / gnod pa nyung ngam / nyam nga ba chung ngam /
translated: When you get there, with my words bow your head at the feet of the Blessed One and say,🔽'Are there few problems?

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: Are there few difficulties?

original: 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan nam /🔽zo mdog bde'am /
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan nam / zo mdog bde'am /
translated: Are you strong?🔽Are you well?

original: bde ba la legs par gnas sam zhes smra'o //
analyzed: bde ba la legs par gnas sam zhes smra'o //
translated: Are you living comfortably?'

original: btsun pa aa mra skyong ma btsun pa la 'di skad du gang gi @78a * //
analyzed: btsun pa aa mra skyong ma btsun pa la 'di skad du gang gi @78a * //
translated: Venerable, the venerable mango grove caretaker says this: 'Are there few problems?

original: tshe bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can du gshegs pa de'i tshe thog mar aa mra'i tshal du thugs brtse bar dgongs nas gshegs su gsol zhes smros shig / de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas aa mra skyod mas smras pa thos nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der
analyzed: tshe bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can du gshegs pa de'i tshe thog mar aa mra'i tshal du thugs brtse bar dgongs nas gshegs su gsol zhes smros shig / de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas aa mra skyod mas smras pa thos nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der
translated: Then the parrot, having heard the words of the mango-grove keeper, went to where the Blessed One was.

original: chas so// de li tstsha b'i gzhon nu rnams kyis mthong nas /
analyzed: chas so// de li tstsha b'i gzhon nu rnams kyis mthong nas /
translated: The Licchavi youths saw him and🔽said, Our prostitute's parrot is going! and they began to shoot arrows.

original: ji ltar bdag cag gi smad 'tshong ma'i ne tso 'gro yin 'dug gi zhes mda' 'phangs par brtsams pa dang / de dag gi spyi bor mda' de dag lhung bar brtsams pa dang / de nas ne tsos tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag gi smad 'tshong ma'i ne tso 'gro yin 'dug gi zhes mda' 'phangs par brtsams pa dang / de dag gi spyi bor mda' de dag lhung bar brtsams pa dang / de nas ne tsos tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: Those arrows began to fall on their own heads, and then the parrot spoke in verse:🔽It is heard that envoys are not bound

original: gzhan gyi yul mis gnod pa la //🔽pho nya bcings pa min zhes thos //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul mis gnod pa la // pho nya bcings pa min zhes thos //
translated: by the harm of foreign people.

original: bdag ni rgyal ba'i pho nya ste //
analyzed: bdag ni rgyal ba'i pho nya ste //
translated: I am the envoy of the Victorious One,

original: lus can kun gyi gnod ma yin //
analyzed: lus can kun gyi gnod ma yin //
translated: not harming any embodied beings.

original: de dag gis tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: They spoke in verse:

original: khyod kyi tshig la bdag cag gi //
analyzed: khyod kyi tshig la bdag cag gi //
translated: By your words, we are

original: mda' yang chad cing ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mda' yang chad cing ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: The arrow will break and fall.

original: drang srong chen pos rab bsrungs pas //
analyzed: drang srong chen pos rab bsrungs pas //
translated: You are protected by the great sage.

original: khyod ni 'jigs pa med par song //🔽de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
analyzed: khyod ni 'jigs pa med par song // de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der nye bar song ste /
translated: Go without fear.🔽Then the parrot, with his wings spread, went to where the Blessed One was.

original: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
analyzed: nye bar song nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas te /
translated: Having gone there, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: aa mra skyong ma btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byed cing gnod pa nyung ngam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: aa mra skyong ma btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byed cing gnod pa nyung ngam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable Blessed One, Aśoka, the caretaker of the mango grove, bows his head at your feet and asks if you have little trouble, little discomfort,

original: snga ma bzhin du bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri'o //
translated: and so on, up to 'are you well and strong?'

original: bzhin rgyas khyod dang aa mra skyong ma bde bar gyur cig //
analyzed: bzhin rgyas khyod dang aa mra skyong ma bde bar gyur cig //
translated: May you and Aśoka be well.

original: aa mra skyong ma btsun pa la 'di skad du gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can du gshegs pa'i tshe thog mar aa mra'i tshal du thugs brtse bar dgongs nas gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: aa mra skyong ma btsun pa la 'di skad du gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can du gshegs pa'i tshe thog mar aa mra'i tshal du thugs brtse bar dgongs nas gshegs su gsol /
translated: The Venerable Upagupta said to Amrapali, When the Blessed One went to Vaishali, he first went to the mango grove out of compassion.

original: bcom ldan 'das ne tso bzhin rgyas la cang mi gsungs pas gnang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ne tso bzhin rgyas la cang mi gsungs pas gnang bar mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One, like a parrot, remained silent, granting permission.

original: de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas ne tso bzhin rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung nas song ngo //
translated: Then the parrot-keeper, knowing that the Blessed One had granted permission by remaining silent, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and left the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas dong zhing ring po ma lon par khra cig gis srog dang bral bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung nas dong zhing ring po ma lon par khra cig gis srog dang bral bar gyur to //
translated: Not long after he left the presence of the Blessed One, a hawk took his life.

original: de 'chi ba'i du sa byas pa'i 'og tu rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du @78b skyes so //
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i du sa byas pa'i 'og tu rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du @78b skyes so //
translated: After he died, he was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings.

original: 'di ni chos nyid de lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon par lha de la sems rnam pa gsum mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid de lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon par lha de la sems rnam pa gsum mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Soon after the birth of a god, three thoughts occur to him:

original: gang nas shi 'phos /🔽gang du skyes /
analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos / gang du skyes /
translated: from where did I die?🔽where was I reborn?

original: las gang gis skyes zhes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las gang gis skyes zhes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: by what karma was I reborn?

original: des bltas na dud 'gro las 'chi 'phos nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i nang du skyes shing bcom ldan 'das la sems mngon par dad pa'i rgyu las so snyam mo //
analyzed: des bltas na dud 'gro las 'chi 'phos nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i nang du skyes shing bcom ldan 'das la sems mngon par dad pa'i rgyu las so snyam mo //
translated: He sees that he died as an animal and was reborn among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, and that it was due to the cause of faith in the Bhagavān.

original: de nas ne tso'i sngon gyi skye ba'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du bdag zhag la lon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du zhal blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas ne tso'i sngon gyi skye ba'i lha'i bu 'di snyam du bdag zhag la lon nas bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du zhal blta ba'i phyir 'gro ba ni tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: Then the god who was previously the parrot thought, “It is not proper for me to go to see the Bhagavān after many days have passed.

original: bdag zhag ma lon pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal blta bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag zhag ma lon pa nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal blta bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will go to see the Bhagavān after only a few days have passed.”

original: sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dri ma med pa g-yo zhing mu tig gi dra ba phyed pas brgyan cing nyin zhag de nyid la lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / punda r'i ka dang / mandal ra ba dag thogs te 'ong zhing nye bar 'ongs nas mtshan mo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs te /
analyzed: sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor dri ma med pa g-yo zhing mu tig gi dra ba phyed pas brgyan cing nyin zhag de nyid la lha'i me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / punda r'i ka dang / mandal ra ba dag thogs te 'ong zhing nye bar 'ongs nas mtshan mo bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der 'ongs te /
translated: A god who had been a parrot in a previous life, adorned with earrings and half-necklaces of pearls, came that very day, carrying divine flowers of the blue lotus, the lotus, the jasmine, and the coral tree.🔽Having approached, he came to where the Blessed One was staying.

original: nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
analyzed: nye bar 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das la me tog gis gtor te /
translated: Having approached, he scattered the flowers over the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dug go //
translated: Then he sat down to one side in order to hear the Dharma.

original: da dung du yang sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i 'od kyis gnas rgyas par snang bas khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: da dung du yang sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i 'od kyis gnas rgyas par snang bas khyab par gyur to //
translated: Even now, the place where the parrot was born is illuminated by a great light.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin mkhyen par mdzad nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan par mdzad pa sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang khams dang rang bzhin mkhyen par mdzad nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos bstan par mdzad pa sngon ne tsor skyes pa'i lha'i
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god who had been born as a parrot, taught the Dharma accordingly, so that the god who had been born as a parrot would realize the Four Noble Truths.

original: bus thos nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyi shu ri'i rtse mo ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: bus thos nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyi shu ri'i rtse mo ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Having heard it, the god who had been born as a parrot destroyed the twenty peaks of the mountain of views about a real self with the vajra of wisdom and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de bden pa mthong nas lan gsum du ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /
analyzed: de bden pa mthong nas lan gsum du ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /
translated: Having seen the truths, he spoke an inspired utterance three times:

original: btsun pa bdag cag la 'di lta bu phas ma byas mas ma byas /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag la 'di lta bu phas ma byas mas ma byas /
translated: “Venerable, what the Blessed One has done for us has not been done by our fathers,🔽nor by our mothers,🔽nor by our relatives,🔽nor by our friends,🔽nor by our kings,

original: mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dun dang / rgyal po dang / lha rnams kyis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / gnyen 'dun dang / rgyal po dang / lha rnams kyis kyang ma byas /
translated: nor by the gods,🔽nor by our former lovers,

original: sngon gyi mdza' bo dang / dge slong dang bram zes kyang ma byas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad de /
analyzed: sngon gyi mdza' bo dang / dge slong dang bram zes kyang ma byas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad de /
translated: nor by monks or brahmins.

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las bton te /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las bton te /
translated: from the world of hungry ghosts, and from the animal realm.

original: lha dang mi'i go 'phang la gzhag @79a * //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i go 'phang la gzhag @79a * //
translated: He has established me in the human realm.

original: go ; /'khor ba mthar byas so //
analyzed: go ; /'khor ba mthar byas so //
translated: He has brought an end to my cyclic existence.

original: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho skams so //
analyzed: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho skams so //
translated: He has dried up the ocean of my blood and tears.

original: rus pa'i ri bo las bsgral lo //
analyzed: rus pa'i ri bo las bsgral lo //
translated: He has rescued me from the mountain of my bones.

original: ngan song gi sgo bkag go //
analyzed: ngan song gi sgo bkag go //
translated: He has closed the door to the lower realms.

original: mtho ris kyi sgo phye zhing snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi sgo phye zhing snang bar mdzad do //
translated: He has opened the door to the higher realms and has illuminated them for me.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i brag ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te /🔽btsun pa bdag ni mngon par 'phags so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i brag ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas te / btsun pa bdag ni mngon par 'phags so //
translated: He has destroyed the mountain of the view of the transitory collection with the vajra of wisdom.🔽I have seen the result of stream-entry.

original: btsun pa bdag ni mngon par 'phags so //

translated: Then, in such a way that no one would know, he sent the young man carrying the letter to be put in a dog kennel.🔽He took the letter and went to the wall.
