analyzed: de yi ge bzung ste ra bar phyin pa dang zhes pa nas rgyas par phyug po'i mchog gi bu gnyis pa ra bar khyis zos pa'i bar du rgyas par bya ste ;
translated: The best of the rich sent his second son to the wall, who was eaten by a dog.🔽He was sent to the cook and told, “You must put him in the oven and burn him.” He was locked in a room with his only son.

original: bya ba'i gan du btang ste khyod kyis 'di thab kyi nang du bcug ste tshig par bya'o zhes btang ste bu gcig bu sgo bcings te bzhag pa dang zhes pa nas rgyas par nan gyis rgyal bas bstan pa las yi ge blangs te bya ba'i gan du song
analyzed: bya ba'i gan du btang ste khyod kyis 'di thab kyi nang du bcug ste tshig par bya'o zhes btang ste bu gcig bu sgo bcings te bzhag pa dang zhes pa nas rgyas par nan gyis rgyal bas bstan pa las yi ge blangs te bya ba'i gan du song
translated: He was forced to take the letter from the king’s teaching and went to the cook.

original: ba dang / bya bas me dong du bcug nas bsad pa dang / thams cad rta pa gnyis btang ba dang / de dag gis ma slebs par bsad do //
analyzed: ba dang / bya bas me dong du bcug nas bsad pa dang / thams cad rta pa gnyis btang ba dang / de dag gis ma slebs par bsad do //
translated: Then he sent two horsemen to kill the boy, but they did not arrive in time.

original: de nas rang nyid mtshon thogs te rgyal bas bstan pa gsod par rtsom pa na khang pa nang gi mis gang bar mthong nas las kyi mtha'i gnas su song ba dang / de yang phyi rol gyi skye bos gang bar mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas rang nyid mtshon thogs te rgyal bas bstan pa gsod par rtsom pa na khang pa nang gi mis gang bar mthong nas las kyi mtha'i gnas su song ba dang / de yang phyi rol gyi skye bos gang bar mthong nas /
translated: Then he himself took up arms and was about to kill the boy, but he saw the house filled with people. He went to the place of execution, but he saw the outside world filled with people.

original: rgyal bas bstan pa mi yid ches pa zhig gi drung du gang khye'u yi ge gzung ba 'di mthong ma thag tu sa brkos pa'i nang du gsad par gyis zhes yi ge bskur te btang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal bas bstan pa mi yid ches pa zhig gi drung du gang khye'u yi ge gzung ba 'di mthong ma thag tu sa brkos pa'i nang du gsad par gyis zhes yi ge bskur te btang ngo //
translated: Then he sent a letter to the boy, saying, “As soon as you see this letter, kill the boy in the pit.”

original: ji srid du rgyal bas bstan pa mnyan yod du phyin te /🔽ltas mkhan gyis mthong @81a * //
analyzed: ji srid du rgyal bas bstan pa mnyan yod du phyin te / ltas mkhan gyis mthong @81a * //
translated: Then Jīvaka went to Śrāvastī.

original: nas 'di skad ces gzhon nu 'di phun sum tshogs pa dang rgyud pa myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: nas 'di skad ces gzhon nu 'di phun sum tshogs pa dang rgyud pa myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: An astrologer saw him and said, “This boy will experience perfection and lineage.”

original: gzugs 'tshong mas ltas mkhan la dris pa dang des smras pa gzhon nu 'di de ring phyug po'i mchog tu 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs 'tshong mas ltas mkhan la dris pa dang des smras pa gzhon nu 'di de ring phyug po'i mchog tu 'gyur ba'am /
translated: The procuress asked a fortune-teller, who said, “Young man, today he will either become the foremost of the wealthy,

original: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyim du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyim du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: or he will enter the house of death.”

original: de nas des khyim du zhugs te nyal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas des khyim du zhugs te nyal bar gyur to //
translated: Then he entered the house and went to sleep.

original: de nas gzugs 'tshong mas de'i sor mo'i bar nas shog bu blangs te /
analyzed: de nas gzugs 'tshong mas de'i sor mo'i bar nas shog bu blangs te /
translated: Then the procuress took a piece of paper from between his fingers,

original: yongs su bsgyur te de'i sor mo'i bar du bzhag par gyur to //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur te de'i sor mo'i bar du bzhag par gyur to //
translated: changed it, and put it back between his fingers.

original: 'di ltar bris te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bris te /
translated: It was written like this:

original: rgyal bas bstan pa 'di la 'dreg mkhan gyis skra dang kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: rgyal bas bstan pa 'di la 'dreg mkhan gyis skra dang kha spu bregs te /
translated: “In this teaching of the Victorious One, a barber shaves his hair and beard,

original: bu mo gzugs 'tshong ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
analyzed: bu mo gzugs 'tshong ma rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
translated: and a procuress, adorned with all ornaments,

original: ljongs 'di tsam dang rgyal po dang blon po dang yul mis rig cing tshor bar chung ma'i don du sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: ljongs 'di tsam dang rgyal po dang blon po dang yul mis rig cing tshor bar chung ma'i don du sbyin par bya'o //
translated: is given as a wife for a price known and acknowledged by this country, the king, the ministers, and the people.”

original: ji srid du rgyal bas bstan pa gnyid sad nas yid ches pa la shog bu byin pa dang / des kyang thams cad ma lus par de bzhin du byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du rgyal bas bstan pa gnyid sad nas yid ches pa la shog bu byin pa dang / des kyang thams cad ma lus par de bzhin du byas so //
translated: And he did everything without exception just as he had been told.

original: ji tsam na phyug po'i mchog 'ongs te dris pa khyod kyis ji ltar ngas smras pa de bzhin du byas sam /
analyzed: ji tsam na phyug po'i mchog 'ongs te dris pa khyod kyis ji ltar ngas smras pa de bzhin du byas sam /
translated: Then the greatest of the rich men came and asked, “Did you do as I said?”

original: de'i nyis ltab tu byas so zhes des smras so //🔽ji tsam na /
analyzed: de'i nyis ltab tu byas so zhes des smras so // ji tsam na /
translated: “I did it just as you said.”

original: phyug po'i mchog kha nas khrag dron mo skyug cing dus las 'das par gyur pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phyug po'i mchog kha nas khrag dron mo skyug cing dus las 'das par gyur pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then the greatest of the rich men vomited hot blood and died.

original: de nas rgyal po sde rab tu 'pham byed kyis rgyal bas bstan pa phyug po'i mchog tu bzhag par gyur pa'i bar rgyas par byung ste /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po sde rab tu 'pham byed kyis rgyal bas bstan pa phyug po'i mchog tu bzhag par gyur pa'i bar rgyas par byung ste /
translated: Then King Pālaka told in detail how the Victorious One had made the greatest of the rich men his teacher.

original: des sangs rgyas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bltas te sde ston mo la spyan drangs shing phyug po'i mchog byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bltas te sde ston mo la spyan drangs shing phyug po'i mchog byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
translated: He invited the Buddha and the community of monks to a feast, and he was made the foremost of the wealthy. He went forth in the doctrine of the Blessed One and attained arhatship.

original: de skad ces thos pa dang / dge slong rnams the tshom skyes te bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: de skad ces thos pa dang / dge slong rnams the tshom skyes te bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: When they heard this, the monks were doubtful, and they asked the Blessed One about it,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rgyal bas bstan pas las ci zhig byas na gzhan gyi gnod pas ma gnod par gyur /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rgyal bas bstan pas las ci zhig byas na gzhan gyi gnod pas ma gnod par gyur /
translated: “What action did the venerable Jñānin teach that he was not harmed by the harm of others?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, listen!

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag nyon cig / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na b'a r'a na s'i grong khyer du rgyal po tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag nyon cig / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na b'a r'a na s'i grong khyer du rgyal po tshangs pas byin zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
translated: In the past, in the city of Vārāṇasī, there was a king named Brahmadatta.

original: de la bu gdug pa'i bsam pa can zhig skyes so //
analyzed: de la bu gdug pa'i bsam pa can zhig skyes so //
translated: He had a son with a vicious disposition.

original: de'i mdun na 'don la bu snying rje'i bsam pa can zhig skyes so zhes bya ba nas @81b rgyas par rgyal po tshangs pas byin dus las 'das par gyur nas de'i bu rgyal srid la bzhag par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i mdun na 'don la bu snying rje'i bsam pa can zhig skyes so zhes bya ba nas @81b rgyas par rgyal po tshangs pas byin dus las 'das par gyur nas de'i bu rgyal srid la bzhag par gyur to //
translated: He raised him in the palace, and when King Brahmadatta died, he placed his son on the throne.

original: ji tsam na mdun na 'don yang dus las 'das te /
analyzed: ji tsam na mdun na 'don yang dus las 'das te /
translated: When the chief minister died,

original: rgyal pos tshor nas song la de'i bu khrid de shog dang mdun na 'don du gzhug par bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //🔽ji cam na de 'ongs pa mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos tshor nas song la de'i bu khrid de shog dang mdun na 'don du gzhug par bya'o zhes bka' stsal to // ji cam na de 'ongs pa mthong nas smras pa /
translated: the king said, Go and bring his son. I will make him chief minister.🔽 When the prince arrived, the king said, When I was king, did you ever come to see me?🔽 The king made him chief minister.

original: nga gang gi tshe rgyal srid byed pa de'i tshe khyod res 'ga' zhig nga'i drung du 'ong ngam zhes rgyal pos mdun na 'don du gzhug go //
analyzed: nga gang gi tshe rgyal srid byed pa de'i tshe khyod res 'ga' zhig nga'i drung du 'ong ngam zhes rgyal pos mdun na 'don du gzhug go //
translated: The prince said, If you promise to do this, I will do it.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The king said, What is it?

original: nges pa zhig byas te gang 'ga' zhig 'gum par 'os pa de bdag gis rig bzhin du 'gum par mdzod cig / rgyal pos smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: nges pa zhig byas te gang 'ga' zhig 'gum par 'os pa de bdag gis rig bzhin du 'gum par mdzod cig / rgyal pos smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: The prince said, When someone is about to die, I will know it and you will let me kill them.

original: ji tsam na srog chags brgya stong du ma rgyal po la zhus te srog las thar bar byas so //
analyzed: ji tsam na srog chags brgya stong du ma rgyal po la zhus te srog las thar bar byas so //
translated: After a while, he saved the lives of many hundreds of thousands of living beings by petitioning the king.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po'i gsad par bya ba zhig nye bar gnas pa na /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po'i gsad par bya ba zhig nye bar gnas pa na /
translated: Then, at another time, a man was to be executed by the king.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: mdun na 'don khrid la shog cig dang de la smras shing bltar gzhug go //
analyzed: mdun na 'don khrid la shog cig dang de la smras shing bltar gzhug go //
translated: “Take the chief minister with you and go to him. I will tell him and he will let you go.”

original: ji tsam na rgyal po skyes bu de'i khang par zhugs te /
analyzed: ji tsam na rgyal po skyes bu de'i khang par zhugs te /
translated: Then the king entered the house of that man,

original: mdun na 'don gang na 'dug ces smras pa dang / phyi rol du byung ste song ngo zhes smras so //
analyzed: mdun na 'don gang na 'dug ces smras pa dang / phyi rol du byung ste song ngo zhes smras so //
translated: and asked, “Where is the chief minister?” He was told, “He went out.”

original: ji tsam na rgyal pos gsad par bya ba mdun na 'don gyis rgyal po la zhus pa dang / rgyal pos smras pa khyod la byin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na rgyal pos gsad par bya ba mdun na 'don gyis rgyal po la zhus pa dang / rgyal pos smras pa khyod la byin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the king asked the man to be executed about the chief minister, and the king said, “I give him to you.”

original: rgyas par de skyo ba skyes nas rab tu byung ste rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du byas so //
analyzed: rgyas par de skyo ba skyes nas rab tu byung ste rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon du byas so //
translated: The story continues in detail up to the point where he became disgusted, went forth, and manifested the enlightenment of a solitary buddha.

original: mdun na 'don gyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nye bar spyad pa kun gyis bsnyen bkur byas nas smon lam btab pa'i mdun na 'don de ni rgyal bas bstan pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: mdun na 'don gyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du nye bar spyad pa kun gyis bsnyen bkur byas nas smon lam btab pa'i mdun na 'don de ni rgyal bas bstan pa 'di yin no //
translated: The minister who served him for as long as he lived with all the necessities of life and made the aspiration is this minister taught by the Victor.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas gnod pa'i rgyu rnam pa du ma las grol zhing gzhan gyi nye bar gnod pas ma gnod do //
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas gnod pa'i rgyu rnam pa du ma las grol zhing gzhan gyi nye bar gnod pas ma gnod do //
translated: By the evolution of that action, he was freed from many kinds of harm and was not harmed by others.

original: phyug po'i mchog gi bu las ci zhig byas nas gcig ni rdza mkhan gyi khyim du bsregs /
analyzed: phyug po'i mchog gi bu las ci zhig byas nas gcig ni rdza mkhan gyi khyim du bsregs /
translated: What action did the sons of the foremost of the rich do that one was burned in a potter’s kiln,

original: gnyis pa ni ra ba'i nang du khyis zos /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ra ba'i nang du khyis zos /
translated: the second was eaten by dogs in a charnel ground,

original: gsum pa ni bya bas bsregs /
analyzed: gsum pa ni bya bas bsregs /
translated: and the third was burned by fire?🔽“Monks, listen to that!

original: dge slong dag de'i phyir nyon cig sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na khur bus tshong byed pa gnyis shig b'a r'a n'a s'ir 'ongs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i phyir nyon cig sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na khur bus tshong byed pa gnyis shig b'a r'a n'a s'ir 'ongs so //
translated: Once, in the past, two merchants came to Vārāṇasī carrying loads.

original: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis 'ongs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang gnyis 'ongs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After that, two more came.

original: rgyas par ming rus dris te mthun zhing nor gcig par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyas par ming rus dris te mthun zhing nor gcig par gyur to //
translated: They asked for their names and clans in detail, and they were compatible and had the same wealth.

original: gcig ni b'a r'a na s'ir song nas @82a * //
analyzed: gcig ni b'a r'a na s'ir song nas @82a * //
translated: One went to Vārāṇasī

original: zas kyis 'tsho bar byed la /
analyzed: zas kyis 'tsho bar byed la /
translated: and made a living by selling food.

original: gsum ni tshong byed do //
analyzed: gsum ni tshong byed do //
translated: The other three engaged in trade.🔽At one time, he offered a meal to a solitary buddha.

original: ji tsam na des rang sangs rgyas la bsod snyoms gcig phul ba de dag gis thos te khros nas smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na des rang sangs rgyas la bsod snyoms gcig phul ba de dag gis thos te khros nas smras pa /
translated: The other three heard about this and became angry, saying,

original: gal te rab tu byung ba de nga'i dbang du gyur na rdza mkhan gyi rdza ma'i gnas su bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rab tu byung ba de nga'i dbang du gyur na rdza mkhan gyi rdza ma'i gnas su bsreg par bya'o //
translated: “If that monk had come under my power, I would have burned him in a potter’s kiln.”

original: gnyis pas smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis pas smras pa /
translated: The second one said,

original: gal te rab tu byung ba de nga'i dbang du gyur na gson bzhin ra bar khyi la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rab tu byung ba de nga'i dbang du gyur na gson bzhin ra bar khyi la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “If that monk had come under my power, I would have given him to the dogs while he was still alive.”

original: gsum pas smras pa /
analyzed: gsum pas smras pa /
translated: The third one said,🔽“I would have burned him in the fire used for cooking.”

original: ngas bya ba'i thab tu bsreg par bya'o zhes gang gis tshig smras pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa yongs su smin to //
analyzed: ngas bya ba'i thab tu bsreg par bya'o zhes gang gis tshig smras pa de bzhin du rnam par smin pa yongs su smin to //
translated: The one who said, “I would have burned him in a potter’s kiln,” experienced the result of that action by being burned in a potter’s kiln.🔽The one who said, “I would have given him to the dogs while he was still alive,” experienced the result of that action by being given to the dogs while still alive.🔽The one who said, “I would have burned him in the fire used for cooking,” experienced the result of that action by being burned in the fire used for cooking.

original: gang gis rang sangs rgyas la bsod snyoms 'bul ba de ni rgyal bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rang sangs rgyas la bsod snyoms 'bul ba de ni rgyal bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The one who offered a meal to the solitary buddha was taught by the Victorious One.

original: chos len pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos len pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Accepting the Dharma” means

original: chos len pa yang rgyal bas bstan pa ltar mas dur khrod du bskyur yang bden pa mthong bar 'os pa yin pas ma shi ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos len pa yang rgyal bas bstan pa ltar mas dur khrod du bskyur yang bden pa mthong bar 'os pa yin pas ma shi ba lta bu'o //
translated: The Dharma is also to be received, as taught by the Victorious One. Even if one's mother were to be cast out in the charnel ground, she should be seen as true, as if she were not dead.

original: mchog can dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog can dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one with supreme faith, and so on.

original: rgyal po'i khab na tshe dang ldan pa mchog can zhes bya ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na tshe dang ldan pa mchog can zhes bya ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu lhan cig gnas so //
translated: In Rājagṛha, there was one named the Venerable Supreme Faith, and the Venerable Śāriputra lived together with him.

original: de bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa dang rgyal po'i khab na phyug po'i mchog ces bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: de bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa dang rgyal po'i khab na phyug po'i mchog ces bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: When he went out for alms, in Rājagṛha there was a wealthy man called Supreme,

original: de la 'bangs po yid ches pa rkun ma zhes bya ba yod de phyug po skyed mos tshal du song ste 'bangs po yid ches pa rkun ma la bskul zhing smras pa /
analyzed: de la 'bangs po yid ches pa rkun ma zhes bya ba yod de phyug po skyed mos tshal du song ste 'bangs po yid ches pa rkun ma la bskul zhing smras pa /
translated: and he had a trusted servant named Thief. The wealthy man went to the garden and urged the trusted servant Thief, saying,

original: song la khyim nas cung zad cig khyer la shog cig ces smras so //
analyzed: song la khyim nas cung zad cig khyer la shog cig ces smras so //
translated: Go and take a little from the house and come back.

original: de smad 'tshong mas bslus te phyug po'i chung ma'i dpung pa gnyis gdu bu'i phyir bcad do //
analyzed: de smad 'tshong mas bslus te phyug po'i chung ma'i dpung pa gnyis gdu bu'i phyir bcad do //
translated: He was deceived by the prostitute, and the wealthy man's wife cut off both her shoulders with a bracelet.

original: de mi rnams kyis bdas pa dang de'i lhung bzed du dpung pa gnyis po de bcug go //
analyzed: de mi rnams kyis bdas pa dang de'i lhung bzed du dpung pa gnyis po de bcug go //
translated: When people saw him, they put his two shoulders into his alms-bowl.

original: de ji srid du rgyal po ma skyes dgras mchog can gsal shing la bskyon pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ji srid du rgyal po ma skyes dgras mchog can gsal shing la bskyon pa'i bar du'o //
translated: He remained like that until King Ajātaśatru impaled Śreṇika.

original: ji tsam na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gsal shing la gnas bzhin du gdams ngag phog ste yang dag par skyo nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gsal shing la gnas bzhin du gdams ngag phog ste yang dag par skyo nas dgra bcom pa nyid thob ste /
translated: Then, while still on the stake, the noble Śāriputra gave him instructions, and he became disgusted and attained arhatship.🔽He took the stake and rose up into the sky.

original: gsal shing khyer nas nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags so zhes rgyas par byung ba dang / 'dam bu can gyi grong khyer na phyug po zhig la bu gcig dang bu mo zhig dang gnyis skyes te /
analyzed: gsal shing khyer nas nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags so zhes rgyas par byung ba dang / 'dam bu can gyi grong khyer na phyug po zhig la bu gcig dang bu mo zhig dang gnyis skyes te /
translated: In the town of Naḷakūṭa there was a rich man who had two children, a boy and a girl.

original: de gnyis phan tshun du shin tu mthun no //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun du shin tu mthun no //
translated: The two were very fond of each other.

original: ji tsam na de gnyis rtse ba las ltogs te ma'i drung du song nas @82b smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na de gnyis rtse ba las ltogs te ma'i drung du song nas @82b smras pa /
translated: When they were playing, they became hungry and went to their mother and said,🔽“Mother, give us food.”

original: ma bdag cag bkres kyis zan byin cig / de gnyen rnams la yongs su 'drim pas ngal bas khyod cag rang gnyis long la zo zhig ces smras so //
analyzed: ma bdag cag bkres kyis zan byin cig / de gnyen rnams la yongs su 'drim pas ngal bas khyod cag rang gnyis long la zo zhig ces smras so //
translated: The son said to his relatives, You are tired from traveling. Eat yourselves.

original: bus smras pa /
analyzed: bus smras pa /
translated: The son said,

original: khyod gsal shing la bskyon nam zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyod gsal shing la bskyon nam zhes smras so //
translated: Will you impale me on a stake?

original: bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: bu mos smras pa /
translated: The daughter said,

original: khyod kyi dpung pa gnyis bcad dam /

translated: Most of those who are to be executed desire to live for a moment.

original: khyod ni srog nyams 'dod pa 'di ci rnam pa 'di gang las //
analyzed: khyod ni srog nyams 'dod pa 'di ci rnam pa 'di gang las //
translated: But you desire to lose your life. What kind of person are you?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: gang gi gang la yang dpal du rtogs pa de don du gnyer bar byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi lugs yin la /
analyzed: gang gi gang la yang dpal du rtogs pa de don du gnyer bar byed pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi lugs yin la /
translated: “It is the way of the world that one who is prosperous seeks what is prosperous.

original: bdag kyang 'chi ba la dpal du rtogs na don du gnyer ba yin gyis /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'chi ba la dpal du rtogs na don du gnyer ba yin gyis /
translated: If I too realize that death is glorious, then I will pursue it.🔽So quickly fulfill the hopes and desires of my mind.

original: myur du bdag gi yid la re zhing don du gnyer ba yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig / gzhan du na bdag rkun ma zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bdag gi yid la re zhing don du gnyer ba yongs su rdzogs par gyis shig / gzhan du na bdag rkun ma zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be pointless for me to be called a thief.”

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again he said:

original: gsal shing la @84b bskyon skra grol lus las khrag 'dzag cing /
analyzed: gsal shing la @84b bskyon skra grol lus las khrag 'dzag cing /
translated: “I am impaled on a stake, my hair is loose, blood flows from my body,

original: mig gi 'bras bu bya rog gis bton 'og tu 'dzag pa dang / spyang ki kang ka stag gis sha dang khrag dag yongs su bgrod gyur nas //
analyzed: mig gi 'bras bu bya rog gis bton 'og tu 'dzag pa dang / spyang ki kang ka stag gis sha dang khrag dag yongs su bgrod gyur nas //
translated: and crows pluck out my eyeballs, which fall below. Jackals, herons, and tigers devour my flesh and blood.

original: srog gi sbyin pa btang ste dur khrod gnas su bdag srog dor ba ltos //
analyzed: srog gi sbyin pa btang ste dur khrod gnas su bdag srog dor ba ltos //
translated: Look, I give the gift of life and abandon my life in the charnel ground.”

original: de dag phan tshun du brtags te smras pa /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun du brtags te smras pa /
translated: They examined each other and said:

original: rnam pa du ma'i brjod pa 'di ni ngo mtshar te /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma'i brjod pa 'di ni ngo mtshar te /
translated: “This statement in many ways is amazing.

original: slar rgyal pos ma thos kyi bar du bdag cag gis de gsal shing la bskyon par mi nus so //
analyzed: slar rgyal pos ma thos kyi bar du bdag cag gis de gsal shing la bskyon par mi nus so //
translated: We cannot impale him on a stake until the king hears about it.”

original: da nas gshed ma'i skyes bu zhig log ste rgyal po la zhus so //
analyzed: da nas gshed ma'i skyes bu zhig log ste rgyal po la zhus so //
translated: Now a man of the executioner caste came back and reported to the king.

original: rgyal pos bkug nas dris pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos bkug nas dris pa /
translated: The king summoned him and questioned him:

original: khyod kyis 'di skad du brjod pa bden nam /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di skad du brjod pa bden nam /
translated: “Is it true that you said this?”

original: des lha mad lags so zhes smras so //
analyzed: des lha mad lags so zhes smras so //
translated: He said, “Your Majesty, it is true.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: shi ste don ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: shi ste don ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: “What purpose will be served by your death?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: “I will go forth in the doctrine of the Buddha.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: gson bzhin ston pa ma thob na //
analyzed: gson bzhin ston pa ma thob na //
translated: “If you do not obtain the Teacher while alive,

original: shi nas ji ltar thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: shi nas ji ltar thob par 'gyur //
translated: how will you obtain him after death?”

original: gang las nges pa 'di skyes pa //
analyzed: gang las nges pa 'di skyes pa //
translated: “From what is this certainty born?

original: ci yid don du bden par smros //
analyzed: ci yid don du bden par smros //
translated: Tell me the truth, what is on your mind?”

original: des rgyal po la smras pa /
analyzed: des rgyal po la smras pa /
translated: He said to the king,

original: lha gal te bdag smra na rab tu byung ba'i phyir bdag shi bar 'dod do //
analyzed: lha gal te bdag smra na rab tu byung ba'i phyir bdag shi bar 'dod do //
translated: “Your Majesty, if I am to speak, I wish to die in order to go forth.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /🔽khyod kyis go rims bzhin du ma bstan gyis /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa / khyod kyis go rims bzhin du ma bstan gyis /
translated: The king said,🔽“You did not teach in order,🔽so speak in order.”

original: de ji ltar go rims bzhin du rgyas par smros shig ;
analyzed: de ji ltar go rims bzhin du rgyas par smros shig ;
translated: “How will you teach in order?”

original: des ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du rang gi gtam rgyas par smras nas gsol pa /
analyzed: des ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du rang gi gtam rgyas par smras nas gsol pa /
translated: As he had been told, he related his story in detail and said, Please look at me, O God!

original: lha gzigs mdzod cig / gang las srog 'byin la sogs thub pa sdug bsngal myong gyur pa //
analyzed: lha gzigs mdzod cig / gang las srog 'byin la sogs thub pa sdug bsngal myong gyur pa //
translated: Those who are the source of life and so forth, who are the sages, who have experienced suffering,🔽All of that is for the sake of others, not for themselves. They engage for the sake of others.

original: de yi thams cad gzhan don bcas shing rang min gzhan don 'jug / de ltar rig kyang gang zhig bka' la gnas par mi byed pa //
analyzed: de yi thams cad gzhan don bcas shing rang min gzhan don 'jug / de ltar rig kyang gang zhig bka' la gnas par mi byed pa //
translated: Even though they know this, those who do not abide by the teachings,

original: 'du shes med cing rtsva phung dang 'dra sa yi khur bur zad //
analyzed: 'du shes med cing rtsva phung dang 'dra sa yi khur bur zad //
translated: Are like a lump of earth, devoid of consciousness, like a heap of grass.

original: ston pa zhir gshegs de'i tshogs ri mo 'drar thar gyur pa'i lam //
analyzed: ston pa zhir gshegs de'i tshogs ri mo 'drar thar gyur pa'i lam //
translated: The path to liberation has been shown by the Teacher who has passed into nirvana.

original: de yi go 'phang sems rmongs 'phel bas gtums shing sgrib pa na //
analyzed: de yi go 'phang sems rmongs 'phel bas gtums shing sgrib pa na //
translated: The path to liberation is obscured by the increase of the delusion of the mind,

original: phan pa ji ltar bya bar nus zhes de ltar nges pa ni //
analyzed: phan pa ji ltar bya bar nus zhes de ltar nges pa ni //
translated: How can I be of benefit? With this certainty,

original: mya ngan 'das pa ji srid lta ba'i sgra 'di stobs med bya //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa ji srid lta ba'i sgra 'di stobs med bya //
translated: The sound of the view of nirvana should be rendered powerless.

original: gang zhig ngan 'gro sna tshogs bdag nyid gang du bkod pa dang // gnas gtsang spangs pa'i bde 'gror yun ring ma skyes gang zhig yod //
analyzed: gang zhig ngan 'gro sna tshogs bdag nyid gang du bkod pa dang // gnas gtsang spangs pa'i bde 'gror yun ring ma skyes gang zhig yod //
translated: Who has been placed by me in various lower realms, and who has not been born for a long time in the happy realms, having abandoned the Pure Abodes?

original: rnam mang gnas su byung bar ma gyur sems can gang zhig yod //
analyzed: rnam mang gnas su byung bar ma gyur sems can gang zhig yod //
translated: Who is the being who has not arisen in the many abodes?

original: @85a * // blo ldan rang gzhan de ltar mthong ba 'gro ba'i phra rgyas 'grol //
analyzed: @85a * // blo ldan rang gzhan de ltar mthong ba 'gro ba'i phra rgyas 'grol //
translated: The wise one, seeing himself and others in this way, liberates the world from its latent tendencies.

original: rgyal pos de'i tshig thos nas padma'i sbubs ltar ngo mtshar ba'i spyan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos de'i tshig thos nas padma'i sbubs ltar ngo mtshar ba'i spyan gyis smras pa /
translated: When the king heard these words, he said with eyes as wondrous as the heart of a lotus:

original: kye bdag gi gzu lums su dpyad pa sngon du ma btang bar gshed ma las bka' lung stsal to //🔽phyir rgol smra bar gyur pa sna tshogs kyi //
analyzed: kye bdag gi gzu lums su dpyad pa sngon du ma btang bar gshed ma las bka' lung stsal to // phyir rgol smra bar gyur pa sna tshogs kyi //
translated: Alas, without first examining my rashness, I have given orders to the executioners.🔽Have you not seen the various fruits of actions,

original: las dang 'bras bu lkog gyur ma mthong ngam //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu lkog gyur ma mthong ngam //
translated: the hidden results of resistance and speech?

original: khyod kyis bden pa mthong bar gyur tam ci //
analyzed: khyod kyis bden pa mthong bar gyur tam ci //
translated: Have you seen the truth, or what?

original: thub ces the tshom bsams pa 'di cis 'phangs //
analyzed: thub ces the tshom bsams pa 'di cis 'phangs //
translated: Why do you advance this thought of doubt?

original: sems la sangs rgyas rjes su dran bcas khyod bsad cing //
analyzed: sems la sangs rgyas rjes su dran bcas khyod bsad cing //
translated: You have killed him, who had the Buddha in his mind,

original: 'jig rten gnod bcas bdag gi 'gro ba gang zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnod bcas bdag gi 'gro ba gang zhig 'gyur //
translated: What will become of me, the world’s protector, now that I am afflicted?

original: bu gcig dga' bar mdzod cig sems dang bka' yis gnod bsal te //
analyzed: bu gcig dga' bar mdzod cig sems dang bka' yis gnod bsal te //
translated: Be pleased, my only son, and with your mind and words remove my pain.

original: rim gyis lung bstan rab byung dngos po thob la shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: rim gyis lung bstan rab byung dngos po thob la shes par 'gyur //
translated: Gradually you will obtain the state of ordination and the prophecy.

original: gsad bya gsad bya ma yin gnod dang zhi 'bras bka' lung can //
analyzed: gsad bya gsad bya ma yin gnod dang zhi 'bras bka' lung can //
translated: You are the one who has the authority to kill and not to kill, to harm and to bring peace.

original: 'di la pha dang ma bzhin rgyal 'bangs kun la mnga' bdag ste //
analyzed: 'di la pha dang ma bzhin rgyal 'bangs kun la mnga' bdag ste //
translated: You are the lord of all the people of the country, as if they were your father and mother.

original: khyod ni nga yi srog sbyin pa yi bu yi mchog yin te //
analyzed: khyod ni nga yi srog sbyin pa yi bu yi mchog yin te //
translated: You are the best of my sons, the one who has given me life.

original: rjes su gnang nas rab byung zhi thob the tshom ma byed cig //
analyzed: rjes su gnang nas rab byung zhi thob the tshom ma byed cig //
translated: With my permission, obtain the peace of ordination. Do not hesitate.

original: bu mthong ngam /
analyzed: bu mthong ngam /
translated: Have you seen my son?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje mchog gi spyod pa sna tshogs mnga' ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thugs rje mchog gi spyod pa sna tshogs mnga' ba //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, who has various activities of supreme compassion,

original: bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin dang / dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas gdul bya ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / rang bzhin dang / dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa'i gnas skabs la ltos nas gdul bya ba la 'jug ste /
translated: He engages in guiding disciples in consideration of their attitude, latent tendencies, elements, nature, fully ripened faculties, roots of virtue, and the occasion whether timely or untimely.

original: nga 'di snyam du khyod la rnam par smin pa nges pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa yod pas thugs rjes btang snyoms su mdzad do //
analyzed: nga 'di snyam du khyod la rnam par smin pa nges pa'i las kyis 'phangs pa yod pas thugs rjes btang snyoms su mdzad do //
translated: I think, “You have karma certain to ripen, so I am compassionate and neutral.”

original: zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes dgongs so //
translated: He thinks this.
